content.text: Geography as Social Science : Contributions to selected problems of cultural geography research ; Wolfgang Kuls on his 65th birthday ; [With English version] With 62 illustrations and 64 tabs.From the introduction: The contributions of this volume reflect the research areas of the Bonn geographer Wolfgang Kuls, and in numbers they outweigh the population geography.
content.title_en: Geography as Social Science : Contributions to selected problems of cultural geography research ; Wolfgang Kuls on his 65th birthday ; [With English version] With 62 illustrations and 64 tab.

content.text: Balanced scorecard : Successfully implement strategies. The management tool developed by Kaplan/Norton to improve the effectiveness of strategy implementation. The Balanced Scorecard allows for the measurement, control and documentation of strategic activities of a company or organisation. Experts show why the Balanced Scorecard should be used efficiently in each company. In addition to the system's construction, the integration of the Balanced Scorecard into the planning and management of the company is explained. Numerous company examples demonstrate the practical success. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Balanced scorecard : Successful implementation of strategies

content.text: The "Paint" used to be an unfit item for the design of Windows 10 and Paint 3D: the digital drawing school for everyone. Software for digital image editing has to be neither complicated nor expensive. Today, the "Paint" is included as a new "Paint 3D" in all Windows 10 versions, is relatively easy to use and much more powerful than its predecessor. This title to Paint 3D starts with a short chapter on design bases, then deals with typical tasks (import of images into the PC, designing maps and posters, image presentation) and ends with a chapter on printers and printing images. The explanations are limited to the essentials, but sufficiently detailed. The selection of topics, layout, depth of explanations are geared to a quick "problem solution" and clearly to casual users without relevant prior knowledge. Good: All chapters are marked in color, the writing is slightly painted, all images are printed in high-quality colour. Conclusion: balanced, well-usable title to a software that many users already have on the PC and which is well-enough for many tasks.
content.title_en: Drawing and Designing with Windows 10 and Paint 3D : the digital drawing school for everyone

content.text: Brand Design : Strategies for the digital world. Name, logo, claim, color, font, image world, sound and language ensure the recognition of a brand's Wiedbekennung in the market. But are the codes also valid in the digital world? How can a brand adapt to the media-specific aesthetics of Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest and Snapchat? What happens when people interact on the Internet of Things through language and movement? The manual highlights all aspects of the current challenges. The focus is on the know-how transfer: In addition to the latest insights from consumer research, innovative solutions and best cases are explained practically and well-founded by renowned experts. The topics : Communication Design, Corporate Design, Experience Design, Screendesign, Strategic Brand Management
content.title_en: Brand Design : Strategies for the Digital World

content.text: The programmies are already available in numerous languages in the "... for dummies" series. Now after a long break ("Programming for Dummies", 2005) a general programmer is available in the popular series. The computer scientist Lorig starts with the basics of programming and describes the general programming concepts as well as the different programming languages. The main content then makes programming with Java as well as with HTML/PHP for the web. In addition, there are cheat pages, useful tools and other tips. Target groups are beginners without programming knowledge. The descriptions are understandable, compared to other programmers however, there are quite few step-by-step instructions here. The typical layout looks very simple, in addition to the programming instructions there are only a few black and white screenshots in the content. As a general beginner guide, besides the more special titles, it is possible to learn everywhere.
content.title_en: Learning to program for dummies

content.text: The basics of mathematics in a technical study programme are presented in a single volume. The form and content are designed to meet the specific requirements of a Bachelor's degree programme. The book is suitable for reading-accompanying self-learning. All examples contain a detailed calculation path with many intermediate steps and illustrations. Numerous tasks for understanding, computing technology and applications are used to deepen and prepare for exams. Access to mathematical facts is provided by understandable instructions, colored graphics and carefully selected examples. Much emphasis is placed on clarity and transparency in structure and language. A small collection of formulas and short portraits of some important mathematicians in the appendix round off the presentation. Solutions to the tasks can be found on the authors' website.
content.title_en: Mathematics for Engineering

content.text: Information technology : Hardware - Software - Networks. The "Compendium of Media Design" was first single-volume, from the 6th edition four-volume (not shown here) and is now divided into 26 narrower volumes between the years 2017 and 2019 as "Library of Media Design". Here the volume "Web Design" was discussed, further titles are planned for discussion. The present book "Information Technology" offers an introduction to the topics hardware, software and networks on a good 100 pages. Basic knowledge from the areas of computers and peripheral devices is taught. In some places, for more detailed information, refer to other volumes of the series. In addition to the explanations, there are some colored illustrations and screenshots in the content. After each chapter there are tasks for filling out the book - the solutions are in the appendix. The book is suitable as a teaching and work book for the target group of trainees and students of media design, but offers no deeper information.
content.title_en: Information technology : Hardware - Software - Networks

content.text: Selman Selmanagić and the Bauhaus. Selman Selmanagic (1905–1986) is one of the important representatives of the Bauhaus ideas after 1933. As head of the architectural department of the Berlin-Weißensee Art Academy, he was influential university teacher and influential designer for the workshops in Dresden-Hellerau. For the architectural studies, the carpenter who had previously been trained in Srebrenica came to the Bauhaus rather by chance. After his shooting in 1932 he travelled to Turkey and Palestine, later he worked among others in the office of Egon Eiermann. From 1945 he worked in the planning collective under Hans Scharoun on the plans for the reconstruction of Berlin. In 1950 his "Stadium der Weltjugend" was created at Chausseestraße. In the same year Mart Stam appointed the head of the architectural department of the Kunsthochschule in Berlin-Weißensee, the popular and charismatic university teacher was able to develop a great influence on the architectural training in the GDR – with working methods and teaching contents, here he worked on generations of students, despite the turn of the GDR from modern and in the modern school for the construction work in Dresden.
content.title_en: Selman Selmanagić and the Bauhaus

content.text: Google Data Studio : Create professional reports and dashboards. "Google Data Studio" is a cloud-based analysis and reporting tool that easily combines, analyzes, and divides complex data. The program was launched in 2016 and is still relatively unknown. The user numbers and thus the target group are (still) small. The book is the only monograph on the topic so far. After an introduction, the integration of different data sources is described first; the processing of the data by own dimensions and measured values and finally the planning and data visualization follows. In further chapters - the content architecture has an inhomogeneous effect from here - aspects of administration, possibilities of publication, permissions and two case studies follow. Overall, the topic is introduced in a vivid, tutorial way, whereby the language will not win a price for elegance. Many illustrations, especially screenshots (partly ill-readable). The overall impression is valuable.
content.title_en: Google Data Studio : Create professional reports and dashboards

content.text: Technical documentation: Standards for technical product documentation and document management. The requirements for technical documentation are constantly growing. Liability aspects play a role here as well as traceability, reproducibility and data exchange. This collection of standards (original texts) designed specifically for technical editors, draughtsmen, product managers, university lecturers and experts provides all structural elements that are needed for the construction and maintenance of a technical product documentation: documentation system (construction, modifications, release, tampering safety) // document management (metadata) // user and operating instructions // product life cycle // presentation of three-dimensional CAD models // classification and identification of documents // protection note // fonts // terms (CAD models, drawings, parts lists) // drawing preprints // fonts.
content.title_en: Technical documentation : Standards for technical product documentation and document management

content.text: The project is divided into two sections: the topic "Individuality of the Environmental Action" and the topic "Individuality of the Environmental Action" (individual event of the Environmental Action) and the topic "Individual Event" (individual event of the Environmental Action). The project "Individual Event" is divided into four sections: The Environmental Action of the Environmental Action (individual event of the Environmental Action) and the Environmental Action (individual event of the Environmental Action). The project "Individual Event" is divided into four sections: The Environmental Action and the Environmental Action (individual event of the Environmental Action). The project "Individual Event" is divided into four sections: The Environmental Action and the Environmental Action (individual event of the Environmental Action).
content.title_en: Individual environmental action and climate protection (India) – substantive and final report : Integration of results and transdisciplinary exploitation of findings from SÖF research on the social dimensions of climate protection and climate change : Project duration: 01.04.2014-31.12.2014

content.text: Wood chips from short-circuit: fuel quality and combustion behaviour. The fuel quality of wood chips from short-circuit (KUP) is often different from the quality of wood chips. In addition to a typically increased water content for KUP, the high content of combustion-critical ingredients, especially nitrogen, cadmium, zinc and aerosol-forming elements, is striking. Fresh KUP chip chips are expected to achieve overall higher emissions of CO, NOX and total dust during combustion in small combustions. The TFZ report 56 contains results on the fuel quality and combustion behaviour of KUP chip chips from two projects funded by the Bavarian State Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Forestry. The analyses were carried out via the Technology and Production Centre (TFZ) and via the Bavarian State Institute for Forest and Forestry (LWF). The focus of the work was on the influence of the tree type, the rotation time, the treatment or the site.
content.title_en: Short-drive wood chips : fuel quality and combustion behaviour

content.text: I see water that you don't see: education for sustainable development using the virtual water as an example. Due to the global challenges, the task of the technical lessons is to provide students with an understanding of the networking of topics. The special issue shows on concrete examples how the subject is implemented in teaching in a cross-disciplinary and inter-disciplinary manner. Each subject can contribute to an education for sustainable development. The teaching examples offer methodologically diverse stagings and as well as the corresponding teaching materials in digital form. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: I see water that you don't see: education for sustainable development using the virtual water example

content.text: The main topic of the project was: the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT") and the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT") - the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT") - the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT") - the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT") - the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated into the "Methodology of the MAT") - the "Methodology of the MAT") - the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated) - the "Methodology of the MAT" (integrated) - the "Methodology of the BAT" (inological of the BAT) - The BAT) - The B-Methodology of the BAT) - the "Methology of the "Methology of the B.
content.title_en: Ensuring the feed and food chain in bio- and agro-terrorist (BAT)-damage situations (SiLeBAT) : Subproject: Investigations on pathogen behaviour and detection of BAT-Agents : Final report of the BMBF-Verbundprojekt : Duration 01.10.2010-31.12.2013

content.text: Crystallography : an introduction for students of the natural sciences. Introduction -- The crystal state -- The space grid and its properties -- The crystal structure -- Morphology -- The symmetry principle -- The 14 translation (bravais) grids -- The 7 crystal systems -- The point groups -- The space groups -- Symmetry groups -- Basic concepts of crystal chemistry -- X-ray investigations of crystals -- Crystal construction defects -- Annex -- Solutions of exercise tasks -- Literature, subject list, table (Wulffsches Net)
content.title_en: Crystallography : an introduction for students of the natural sciences

content.text: Eating sustainably out of home: from the idea to the plate. More and more people eat regularly outside the home, a fast-available and flexible diet is now simply part of our modern lifestyle. However, it is not only this flexibility that is important to customers, but also increasingly a high ecological and health quality of the offers. They want attractive, enjoyable and at the same time sustainable food. And they want to be able to trust that their food has been produced according to clearly defined ecological and social requirements. The key to this are innovations in the food supply, in the procurement, spread, labelling - and in the presentation forms. The more than 50 authors of this book work in science and practice for a sustainable development of the food system. Here they provide the approaches developed in the research project NAHGAST and other projects for a sustainable transformation of the out-of-home market for discussion.
content.title_en: Eat sustainably out of the house : from the idea to the plate

content.text: Crash course Storytelling : Basics and implementation. Marketing expert Werner T. Fuchs will teach you in this crash course what Storytelling is, what principles a good story follows and what needs to be observed in the different locations of use. A story check as well as proven methods and instruments will accompany you in the first steps and support you in the practical implementation - including stumbling blocks, and how you avoid them. The optimal start to the successful storytelling! Content: How to avoid typical mistakes How the human brain perceives, stores and retrieves information locations and locations of stories New: Deepening the topics of social media" and digital storytelling" (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Crash Course Storytelling : Basics and Implementation

content.text: Scenography: the compendium for networked design discipline. From the publishing news: "Scenography has long established itself as a discipline and differentiated – whether as a professional field of work, subject of study or design attitude. As soon as stories are translated into space and brought to speech, various experts are involved in making a staging what it should ideally be: a narrative visitor experience with high emotion, communication and memory value...."
content.title_en: Scenography : the compendium for networked design discipline

content.text: Vertical greening : Construction methods and planning bases for greening walls and facades with and without natural soil/ground water connection. This book responds for the first time to the international architectural development for an integrative application of vegetation facades. It offers you arguments for planners, municipal and private builders, maintenance managers and beneficiaries. By clearly systematizing with regard to plant selection, performance factors, supply criteria and constructional aspects, it is a decision-making aid in the selection of suitable facade greening. Information on planning, execution and maintenance as well as instructions for damage prevention enable you to implement the practical implementation.
content.title_en: Vertical greening : Construction methods and planning bases for greening walls and facades with and without natural ground/ground water connection

content.text: The High Line: the green veins of New York. This book presents the planning, development, plant maintenance and background to the High Line project. The over 3 km long area of a former freight train in New York is home to the famous landmark, which was opened as a park in 2014. After the launch of a co-founder of the project, a essay discusses the basics and prerequisites of modern landscape design in urban space, which enabled the emergence of the modern facility. The main part presents the individual garden areas, which are characterized by different design and planting. In addition, chapters on the care of the complex and on seasonal aspects are presented. The atmospheric colour photographs are inspiring and convey a diverse impression of the living green space in the middle of Manhattan.
content.title_en: The High Line : the green veins of New York

content.text: Smart City: Innovations for the connected city – business models and management. The social-political pressure of the energy transition combined with the promising possibilities of a networked, decentralized world within the framework of the ‘Internet of Things' (IoT) accelerates the transformation of cities towards smart cities. While there are some lighthouse cities like Barcelona, Lyon and Vienna that exploit the potential, most cities have an immense need for catching up. The gap between the leading smart cities and the remaining cities is growing, the need for action is often recognized, but the paths are often unclear for decision makers. What are the core elements of a smart city? What are the steps to be taken from analysis of sweet spot to action concept? Where is the potential to be started? How do other cities and what have they learned so far? What can be learned from greenfield approaches from Chinese smart cities? What methods and tools can cities use from city management? What are the business models for the participating companies? How can the different stakeholders be well integrated? This book also provides answers to these questions as well as numerous examples of international research projects.
content.title_en: Smart City: Innovations for the connected city - Business Models and Management

content.text: Introduction to mathematical work. Revised edition of a methodological and contentual introduction to abstract mathematical thinking and work. Review The academic mathematical system differs in terms of method and content from school mathematics. This leads to considerable problems in the initial phase of mathematics. The proven introduction to mathematical work in a 3rd edition (1st edition: 2009) is derived from the teaching practice of a study phase. Taking into account the problematic initial situation, it provides students with a competent methodological and contentual introduction to abstract mathematical thinking and work, and thus provides a number of contents of the 1st study phase in addition to central basic techniques, conventions and knowledge for the presentation of mathematical facts. With numerous examples and tasks. A successful university entrance is very useful. References to explanatory videos round off the 3rd edition.
content.title_en: Introduction to mathematical work

content.text: Concrete mathematics (not only) for computer scientists: with many graphics and algorithms in Python. "With computer science-specific applications, among others from cryptography, coding and complexity theory as well as computer graphics. Supported by many colored graphics, about 1000 tasks with solutions and, last but not least, hundreds of videos, in which one can explain the read again 'personally' by the author."
content.title_en: Concrete Mathematics (not only) for computer scientists : with many graphics and algorithms in Python

content.text: The report of the Federal Ministry of Health and the Federal Environment Agency to consumers on the quality of water for human use (drinking water) in Germany (2014 - 2016) : Reporting period: 1 January 2014 to 31 December 2016 : according to § 21 Drinking water regulation based on the format for reporting of the competent top state authorities (Federal Health Bulletin 2013·56:1191-1215). This report is based on the reports of the Länder to the Federal Ministry of Health (BMG) and the Federal Environment Agency (UBA) over the period 2014 to 2016. The form of the report is based on the report format specified by the European Commission, which is binding for the annual reports of the Länder authorities. In 2016, 72.4 million persons were supplied, which is approximately 88% of the population of Germany, with 4,350.8 million m3 of drinking water (from central installations) in 2,490 water supply areas (distribution of more than 1 000 m3 of drinking water per day or corruption of more than 5 000 persons).
content.title_en: Report of the Federal Ministry of Health and the Federal Environment Agency to consumers on the quality of water for human consumption (drinking water) in Germany (2014 - 2016) : Reporting period: 1 January 2014 to 31 December 2016 : according to § 21 Drinking water regulation using the format for reporting of the competent top state authorities (Federal Health Bulletin 2013·56:1191-1215)

content.text: Angular: the comprehensive manual. Google's open source JavaScript framework is very well suited for the development of contemporary web applications. Angular has established itself on the web framework market since the first edition of the book. The preliminary edition was not available for comparison. After comparing the table of contents (via DNB-Opac) nothing seems to have changed in the structure. Part 1 of the book deals with the Angular core components, which are the basis for further developments. Further topics are presented using a consistent project example. Overall, the scope has been added by 4 new chapters by 194 pages at the same price. New additions are the chapters "Material Design and Angular Material", "Put out Functionality in Libraries and Publish by NPM", "Providing Angular Components as WebComponent" and "Revising Angular Applications on the Server". Screenshots and code lists support the step-by-step instructions, so this book is suitable for beginners and advanced users.
content.title_en: Angular : the comprehensive manual

content.text: The topic of safety of older road users has become an important focus of the behavioral research of the Federal Road Safety Agency (BASt). In the course of various research projects, the BASt was also the organizer of the conference "Ageing and Safe Mobility", which discussed current results from empirical studies on the behaviour of older road users, road infrastructure and vehicle technology. The findings obtained here are taken up in this report and prepared together with results from relevant national and international publications. This review work is intended to help comprehensively revisit the new challenges for road safety, which arise due to the increasing number of older road users and their mobility needs. It also addresses the state of research on mobility needs, age-related driving-related functional changes and compensation mechanisms of older drivers. Furthermore, the suitability of tests for the prediction of elderly drivers and their mobility needs is discussed here, while the focus on driving skills and other measures is aimed at improving traffic regulations.
content.title_en: Demographic change - state of knowledge and recommendations for measures to ensure the mobility of older road users

content.text: The industry is not able to take into account the price of renewable energy. The industry is not able to take into account the price of renewable energy. The industry is not able to take into account the demand of renewable energy sources, but the demand for renewable energy sources is much worse for the renewable energy sector.
content.title_en: Economic promotion through the promotion of renewable energies? : an empirical comparison of the Renewable Energy Act with the traditional economic promotion

content.text: Nietzsche : Biography of his thinking. How hardly a second person has Friedrich Nietzsche shaped the thinking of modernism. He is dynamite, he claimed of himself. One can imagine his thinking as a laboratory in which he experimented with provocative, sometimes risky arguments. His philosophy does not result in a system but rather lives on its inner dynamics. Rüdiger Safranski called his important, highly successful Nietzsche book, which appeared on the 100th anniversary of the death and was translated into many languages. On the 175th birthday of October 15, 2019, a new edition of this standard work appears, extended by an epilogue that reveals the unbroken relevance of Nietzsche's thinking.
content.title_en: Nietzsche : Biography of his thinking

content.text: Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 : the manual for administrators. Microsoft Exchange Server is a widely used groupware for collaboration in a group, especially the exchange of messages. The book here describes the version 2019 available since the beginning of this year and is thus a good replacement for the manuals of Th. Joos, which describe earlier versions (version 2016). The authors are addressed readers with previous knowledge; however, due to the well-explained numerous examples, access is also possible for beginners. The source code of all sample files can be found for download on the net. The author begins briefly with the main innovations of the current version (high availability, support of Windows Server 2019 Core, new search engine, new metacache database, elimination of unified messaging functions) and then sets priorities in configuration. Administration, operation and maintenance of the new Exchange Server. Very helpful are finally also comments on best practices and examples of "unfavorable" exchange implementations
content.title_en: Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 : the manual for administrators

content.text: Artificial intelligence in marketing - a crash course. Whenever we make purchase decisions, we leave traces, often without even realizing this: when shopping online, researching mobile phones or using a customer card. Price adjustments in real time, intelligent systems for customer communication - data and algorithms are increasingly shaping our work. This crash course provides an overview of the application possibilities of artificial intelligence in marketing, explains the underlying technology and describes its implementation using numerous examples. Content: What is artificial intelligence? What tasks do machine learning and deep learning fulfil? Artificial intelligence in marketing Operational forms of AI in marketing Opportunities, challenges and limitations of artificial intelligence (publisher text)
content.title_en: Artificial intelligence in marketing - a crash course

content.text: 1989 in Berlin : Locations of the Peaceful Revolution. As the capital of the GDR, East Berlin was an important centre of the Peaceful Revolution of 1989. Ingo Juchler takes readers to the central locations of events, striking the arc from 17 June 1953 to the protest movement of the 1970s to the demonstrations in autumn 1989 and the events surrounding the fall of the Wall. Informative texts on the background, numerous illustrations and an overview map make the book a vivid time travel guide to recent German history.
content.title_en: 1989 in Berlin : Locations of the Peaceful Revolution

content.text: Information security and data protection - simple & effective : systematically build and anchor integrated management tools. The book highlights the key challenges of data protection and information security including cyber security and the building blocks required for their management using examples. An essential focus is in particular the information security management system as well as the coupling of data protection, information security and EAM as integrated holistic management system for the sustainable anchoring of data protection and information security in the company. A step-by-step guide provides assistance for individual derivation and implementation. The steps are explained using examples. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Information security and data protection - simple & effective : systematically build and anchor integrated management tools

content.text: Research with modern C++ : C++ 17 intensive course for scientists, engineers and programmers. C++ is considered optimal in connection with scientific and technical software to develop large systems of high quality, high performance and fast. In addition to a vivid presentation of the basic definitions and concepts (e.g. object orientation), the focus of the book is therefore on simple interfaces between subsystems of the software and between sub-programmes (high quality). Performance is provided by the Standard Library (new features such as parallelity with efficient use of MultiCores since C++ 11) and the Standard Template Library (efficient algorithms). The fast development is made possible by the use of abstractions of a variety of types (conspicuous representation of generic programming from simple functional and class templates to variadian templates - i.e. templates with variable number of arguments, and clear description of metaprogramming).
content.title_en: Research with modern C++ : C++ 17 intensive course for scientists, engineers and programmers

content.text: Adobe Illustrator CC : the most practical introduction. The most recent version of the vector-oriented graphics and drawing program Adobe Illustrator CC 2019 is currently the one from February 2019 (23.0.2). The second edition (2016) was last discussed with 226 pages, compared to the third edition with 455 pages the current edition was thus only slightly extended. No reference to the underlying program version. Unchanged is still almost as in the first edition (2013, text and picture sometimes identical), innovations such as freehand history, customizable toolbars, scalable work interface, start screen are incorporated, but are not listed separately. Many program-related problems have been fixed. Like the preliminary editions Flemming offers a well-groomed, practical introduction. Preversions do not necessarily have to be deleted. Example and exercise files can be found on the website for the book
content.title_en: Adobe Illustrator CC : the practical introduction

content.text: Bioenergy in the field of tension between energy and climate policy : Strategies for sustainable bioenergy use : Statement. Bioenergy is the most versatile energy source among renewables and provides more energy than wind and hydro power, solar energy and geothermal energy. A consistent bioenergy policy must ensure that bioenergy use has no negative social and environmental consequences and makes a maximum contribution to climate protection.
content.title_en: Biomass in the field of tension between energy and climate policy : Sustainable Bioenergy Strategies : Opinion

content.text: What is Art Nouveau? : an analysis of Art Nouveau architecture; 1890 - 1910. Every elaborately decorated façade of the turn of the century is now called Art Nouveau. However, the special style features and characteristics of this short architectural fashion around 1900 are rarely taken into account. - - Stefanie Lieb describes in the first, systematic part of her book the general conditions and characteristics of Art Nouveau architecture and explains its history of creation as well as the interactions with crafts and design. In the second part she presents the strongholds of European Art Nouveau and its most striking buildings. Glasgow School, Vienna Secession and Parisian Art Nouveau, the Brussels of Victor Horta and the Barcelona of Antoni Gaudí impress with their diversity of forms and imagination.
content.title_en: What is Art Nouveau? : an analysis of Art Nouveau architecture; 1890 - 1910

content.text: Evaluation of Subject Gateways of the Internet : (EJECT). The scope and heterogeneity of the information offer always requires differentiated methods and tools for the targeted and as ballast-free finding of information sources in the context of a particular subject area or a scientific discipline. To achieve this goal, a number of subject gateways have been developed in recent times. So far, neither many studies have been carried out on the quality of such tools nor have a differentiated methodology been developed for such evaluations. The project Evaluation of Subject Gateways of the Internet (EJECT) therefore pursued the objectives:1) by analysing already realised subject gateways to show the use of the term and to contribute to a clarification of the conceptual formation;2) to show a methodical way of qualitative evaluation of Subject Gateways;The results of the evaluation are presented in detail in this study and it is shown in how far a transfer to the evaluation of other gateways is possible.(AUT)
content.title_en: Evaluation of Subject Gateways of the Internet : (EJECT)

content.text: Biomonitoring of the zoobenthon at selected sites in the Elbe: preliminary studies on local and temporal variability including image documentation. In October 1991 the growth of 39 stones from rock-filling in Geesthacht in the tide-free area of the Elbe was analyzed. Among the 17 species detected in the rock-filling, Chironomida larvae, Potamopyrgus jenkinski, Gammarus tigrinus and Cordylophora caspia were considered frequent. Three weeks later 14 soil-grape samples were collected from the mixed sediment of the Mühlenberg hole in the tide-influencing area of the Elbe. 13 species were detected, often only the tubificides, with the species Potamothrix moldaviensis, Limnodrilus hoffmeisteri and L. claparedeanus dominated.
content.title_en: Biomonitoring of the zoobenthon at selected sites in the Elbe : preliminary studies on local and temporal variability including image documentation

content.text: What is good work? Requirements for entering the profession from the perspective of the young generation: Results of a representative survey of young people aged 18 to 34 with completed vocational training.The representative survey "Requirements for entering the profession from the perspective of the young generation" focuses on young people aged 18 to 34 who have at least completed vocational training. According to Mikrozensus (2005), this group of young people trained are about 9.77 million people.The study retrospectively highlights the transition on the second threshold, i.e. the transition from education to work after completing a training or a study (source: Introduction).
content.title_en: What is good work? Requirements for entering the profession from the perspective of the young generation: Results of a representative survey of young people aged 18 to 34 with completed vocational training

content.text: How does Freiraum Stadt find it? : facts, positions, examples. In public space, the cities see their identity represented. Whether as a space for social appropriation and intercultural encounters, as a city residence or as a sequence of streets, alleys and squares that divide the city, as a place for environmental education and nature mediation or as a place for landscape art of urban free space, the book presents the tasks and requirements of these free spaces, shows successful examples and gives recommendations for action.
content.title_en: How does space find city? : facts, positions, examples

content.text: Investment guide for Ukraine. One of the biggest obstacles to Ukraine's integration into the world economy is the lack of information about the country. The investment leader published by the OECD informs about Ukraine in its general characteristics, describes the economic structure and the economic system and then deals with the environment for foreign investments. In detail, the investment legislation and the framework for incentives are discussed. Further chapters deal with business-relevant investment conditions, the tax system and investment opportunities. The annex lists legal and other framework conditions.
content.title_en: Investment guide for Ukraine

content.text: Ecosystem functions of river floodplains: analysis and evaluation of flood retention, nutrient retention, carbon stock, greenhouse gas emissions and habitat function; results of the R & D project (FKZ 3508 850 100). Auen offer a remarkable variety of functions and services to humans. In this publication, the contribution of river flood retention, nutrient and greenhouse gas support and their importance for biodiversity is recorded and valued. The study refers to the floodplains of 79 rivers with an area of 15,000 km2 and allows a supraregional assessment of the benefits of floodplains for our society.
content.title_en: Ecosystem functions of floodplains: analysis and evaluation of flood retention, nutrient retention, carbon stock, greenhouse gas emissions and habitat function; results of the R & D project (FKZ 3508 850 100)
