content.title_en: Concrete structures for wind turbines

content.text: The authors have compiled the most important findings for a basic course of sports science. The thorough didactic preparation is based on the previous knowledge of the students. Further scientific knowledge is not necessary for understanding the basics of movement science and teaching. The scientific knowledge is based on the knowledge of the students.
content.title_en: Fundamentals of Movement Science and Teaching

content.text: IT-supported project- and time-related recording and decision support in the early phase of planning in the inventory (initiation phase) based on an IFC-based CMS. Enth. also: Technical Report Pen-based user interface for input of sketches / Bearb.: Helga Zauber
content.title_en: IT-based project and time-based capture and decision support in the early stage of inventory planning (initiation phase) based on an IFC-based CMS

content.text: The Sketchnote Manual: the illustrated guide to creating visual notes. Sketchnotes, composed of the two words "sketch" and "note" are notes that consist of images, texts and structures. Especially the images are not about creating elaborate drawings, but about sketch-like representations that are more like a design. Sketchnotes can be used to visualize issues, develop thoughts and concepts and open up topics. They can also be used to record lectures and courses. Sketchnotes can be conventionally created with pen and paper, but also digitally using appropriate apps. In digital form, they are often communicated via social media channels and shared with others. The American designer and "sketchnote guru" Mike Rohde describes what sketchnotes are for, what they can be used for and, above all, how they are created. In addition, he presents various types and techniques for creating sketchnotes.
content.title_en: The Sketchnote Manual : the illustrated guide to creating visual notes

content.text: Nutrition, cuisine, service: basic knowledge. Comprehensive textbook for students of vocational and educational preparation courses as well as further education courses for the secondary school degree. Individual work procedures are systematically and professionally listed for the private household and the service business. (LK/KI: Hamm) Basic book of healthy nutrition (food pyramids), health, food requirements (vitamins, nutrients), the human body (digestive, anorexia, overweight) as well as the most important food. According to information on purchasing and cooking (hygiene, accident prevention, various preparation methods such as steams, smiths, roasts) follows an extensive recipe part, tips for the perfectly covered table and the right service. Everything is complexly treated, in attractive layout, well suited for training preparation courses and further training courses to the main school degree. All around a successful school book that leaves no question for the first entry. (2 S) (LK/KI: Hamm)
content.title_en: Nutrition, cuisine, service : basic knowledge

content.text: Entertainment Cities : Entertainment culture and urban development. "Western inner cities today make the impression of increasingly controlled playscapes, which are designed like theme parks and shopping malls to maximize pleasure and profit. ... Therefore, the book Entertainment Cities looks with fundamental ambivalence at current city transformations in the USA, Europe and the Emirates. It locates current trends in social contexts and analyses the variations of public space as precarious experiments in terms of privatisation, commercialization and feminization."--
content.title_en: Entertainment Cities : Entertainment culture and urban development

content.text: The Math-Praxis-Book : How engineers apply mathematics - projects for the Bachelor phase. Explain the practical relevance of mathematics for solving problems from everyday engineering to 4 applications in the fields of control engineering, thermodynamics and building physics for students of engineering subjects of the first semester. Review (ECZ): Mathematics is also of central importance in engineering subjects. It provides numerous methods, concepts and instruments here. Corresponding basic lectures on mathematics sometimes convey quite abstract basic competences. Their practical relevance for the actual subject of study is usually only recognized late. The work now illustrates the practical relevance of mathematics for engineering everyday engineering in 4 applications from the fields of control engineering, thermodynamics and construction physics Students of engineering subjects of the first semesters. The very transparent presentation leads to a very varied work manuals successively from the practical problem to the final mathematical modelling based on the mathematical knowledge acquired in the first two semesters. Helpful hints and detailed solutions complete the work, which is based on an interdisciplinary program of mathematics.
content.title_en: The Math Practice Book : How engineers apply mathematics - Projects for the Bachelor Phase

content.text: Introduction to Media Education: Teaching and Learning with Digital Media. A Current Basic Knowledge for Teaching and Learning with Digital Media in School
content.title_en: Introduction to Media Didactics: Teaching and Learning with Digital Media

content.text: Mathematics at the beginning of the study programme: Basic knowledge for all technical, mathematical and scientific and economic courses. Basic knowledge for all technical, mathematical and scientific and economic courses. (2S)
content.title_en: Mathematics at the beginning of the study programme: Basic knowledge for all technical, mathematical and scientific and economic studies

content.text: Brand and digital media: the transformation of the brand concept in the 21st century. An inventory of what the digital age holds in need of working with brands. A path from persuasion in all its (psychologically supported) forms (to make buyers out of non-buyers), which already generates mass resistance, towards dialogue communication. In the mass of how media users exploit the technical possibilities for information and communication, their perception and reaction behavior changes. A rethink in the understanding of brand, nothing less than a completely new brand concept, is required. This book provides an overview of the current state of the debate about new brand strategies. New research on brand theory complements with solutions and thus provides a sound basis for addressing the challenges of digitalization. Above all, for practitioners.(3)
content.title_en: Brand and digital media: the transformation of the brand concept in the 21st century

content.text: Material science : Structures, properties, testing. The introductory textbook provides material-scientific core knowledge. The well-understood theory is accompanied by examples of application. (Ulrich Isigkeit) Widely introduced basic work for students at specialist and university universities. With this edition (last edition: BA 6/10), responsibility for content and layout changes from long-standing author W. Weißbach to the new author's team Dahms and Jaroscheck. While the textbook was built up, except for slight corrections, the previous 2-column layout is abandoned in order to facilitate readability for electronic systems. All chapters have been updated continuously. The annex has been supplemented by a glossary. Since an eye-friendly typography has also been introduced, the chapter "Tribological stress" (effects by friction and wear) is no longer represented. The standards show the latest status and errors have been corrected. The appendix has been supplemented by a glossary.
content.title_en: Materials science : structures, properties, testing

content.text: Complexities: why we are starting to understand the world. A new challenge for science: the world is complex, so it should be our ideas of it. Many disciplines of the humanities and social sciences have long followed this maxim. However, the natural sciences have traditionally sought simple, universal and timeless laws. They wanted to explain the "blooming, buzzing confusion", William James, which presents the untrained senses to the mind. But this company failed. Sandra Mitchell shows that the complexity of the living world forces us to radically revise our thinking models and to look for a more adequate teaching of knowledge. To this end, the system theory has provided guidelines that have been specified for some years by the complexity theory. Complex systems - such as the world in which we live - are characterized by, among other things, the emergence and relations: what becomes visible on the macro level is only to explain parts by interactions between the elements of the system. Where a bird swarm flies, for example, depends not only on the individuals, but also before they understand the sum between them.
content.title_en: Complexities : why we first begin to understand the world

content.text: Biochemistry : an introduction with 40 learning units. Biochemistry: Learning made easy The content:-The molecules of life -Molecular genetics-metabolism cells and their environment-Molecular physiology-biochemical methods The concept: -40In itself closed learning units from10-15 pages-Overview, short, comprehensive and didactically sophisticated biochemistry: This is how learning is fun
content.title_en: Biochemistry : an introduction with 40 learning units

content.text: Scientifically working with Word: [from Word 2000 to Word 2003]. In scientific work, Microsoft Word is the most frequently used word processing. Due to the many functions, diploma theses and dissertations can be efficiently worked out and designed accordingly. The revised edition of the book contained in BA 4/03 shows how Word can be used in everyday scientific life in versions 2000, 2002 and 2003. An example is a sample diploma thesis, which is designed and prepared gradually, from the correct structure to the delivery as PDF file. Among other things, it includes: data backup and data recovery, document setting and chair setting and inserting content, image and other directories. A comprehensive structure with numerous step-by-step instructions and screenshots, so that cross entry is possible. Should all libraries with appropriate target groups be acquired. (2) (LK/SFB: Green) The daily guide for working with Word for students: it guides students through typical tasks that occur during diploma work and dissertations. Classifications help to look up. The focus is on the challenges created by large documents in Word.
content.title_en: Scientifically working with Word: [from Word 2000 to Word 2003]

content.text: Textbook Methods of Social Work. What are the basics of methodologically supported action that should distinguish professional social work? The introduction provides an overview of the methodological arrangements to be applied, whereby a subject-oriented attitude must be the basis of any action that is justifiable to the occasions with which social work has to be related.
content.title_en: Textbook Methods of Social Work

content.text: The basics of digital signal processing: a mathematical approach. The comprehensive introduction of digital signal processors and computers opens up a universal possibility for processing signals from the coffee machine to the car. The digital signal processing used here is presented in this book as processing deterministic and stochastic signals. First, physical and mathematical signals and signal parameters are described, followed by a consideration of analog time-continuous systems. Subsequently, time-discrete, linear, time-invariant systems and the processing of time-discrete signals are presented in detail. The mathematical methods necessary for solving differences and discrete Fourier transformation are described in detail. This is followed by stochastic signal processing. After a chapter on estimates of autocorrelation function, the book is devoted to the increasingly used model systems. Literature is completed by the book. In contrast to other works, this book is readable via digital signal processing without mathematical additional reading. Necessary mathematical knowledge is clearly derived and refreshed. The book thus applies to students, but also to the signal processing of natural signals.
content.title_en: Basics of digital signal processing: a mathematical approach

content.text: Statistics: Introduction for economists and social scientists. A thorough introduction to the central concepts and methods of both descriptive and closing statistics as well as the necessary areas of probability theory with many examples. (Wolfgang Grölz) A thorough introduction to the central concepts and methods of both descriptive and closing statistics as well as the necessary areas of probability theory with many examples. Review (ekz): The text based on a 2-semester course usual at German universities is targeted at students of subjects with appropriate application requirements, but the detailed, thoroughly designed volume can be recommended more generally for self-study and also for practice. As usual, the first section introduces the most important estimation and testing methods of inductive statistics. The subsequent presentation of the required areas of probability theory then requires at least basic knowledge about analysis, although deeper results are only presented and not proven. As usual, the most important estimation and testing methods of inductive statistics are introduced in the final section.
content.title_en: Statistics : Introduction for economic and social scientists

content.text: Computer and Internet criminal law: a ground plan. Modern information and communication technology presents new challenges to the entire law. Criminal law is the task of recording both classic offences in their new technicalised clothing, and of dealing with new forms of crime that are only possible through the use of computer systems and the Internet. This textbook provides a comprehensive and immediately detailed overview of computer and Internet criminal law, from classic computer fraud and hacking of data to recent criminal manifestations such as domain hijacking and phishing. In addition, it is also dedicated to future developments, especially the increasing internationalisation of the law in this field.
content.title_en: Computer and Internet criminal law : a floor plan

content.text: Twelve teaching methods : variety for practice. Method diversity is an essential quality characteristic of teaching. However, it is rarely implemented in school practice - not least due to the insufficiently documented basic knowledge. The volume offers a tight overview of selected teaching methods Method diversity is an essential quality characteristic of teaching. However, school practicality is rarely redeemed - not least due to the insufficiently documented basic knowledge. The volume offers a tight overview of selected teaching methods.
content.title_en: Twelve methods of teaching : diversity for practice

content.text: Statistics for Dummies: [good advice on data; explained at a glance: bias, sample and probability intelligible; reckon with median, arithmetical means and correlation; get to know the graphical presentation possibilities; with exercises including solutions online]. The author introduces interested parties in the "secrets" or the basics of statistics in a series. Review (kz): Introduced series. The preliminary edition of the book was not available for direct comparison. However, the changes do not seem to be of a profound nature, so that the preliminary edition can expire. However, exercises and their solutions are now available online. In previous editions there was a separate exercise book. The author, who published further titles in the Dummies series, provides general understanding and, based on many everyday examples, basic knowledge of statistics, especially on descriptive statistics. It shows how statistics can be properly read and interpreted. Quite without higher mathematics, she also does not work out. Anyone who wants to use the book in a meaningful way should already have solid mathematical knowledge, e.g. know sum formulas and also understand probability calculation. The Dummies is an introduction of the title of the library.
content.title_en: Statistics for Dummies: [well advised on data; explained at a glance: bias, sample and probability intelligible; reckon with median, arithmetical means and correlation; learn about graphical presentation options; with exercises and solutions online]

content.text: The book focuses on the urban development potential of the Rhine banks, especially the Rhine section of the Cologne/Bonn region. The book also focuses on urban development strategies and financing as well as specific problems such as flood hazards. In the first two parts of the book, the focus is on the urban development potential of the Rhine banks, especially the Rhine section of the Cologne/Bonn region. The comprehensive third part of the book is a collection of 90 examples of projects from all over Europe. The book focuses on the urban development potential of the Rhine banks, especially the Rhine section of the Cologne/Bonn region. The book also focuses on the urban development strategies and financing of the Rhine basin.
content.title_en: Currents : Designing urban river landscapes

content.text: BetrSichV - the responsible electrical specialist in the obligation : legally safe implementation of amended operating safety regulation (BetrSichV) in electrical engineering. The revised operating safety regulation (BetrSichV) enters into force on 1 June 2015. This book answers questions arising from a practical point of view in the working day of the responsible electrical specialist. Answers to the questions: How are BetrSichV, TRBS and DGUV regulation 3 (formerly BGV A3)? What does BetrSichV bring to the user, and where are problems, especially with the electrical tools? What is the hazard assessment good for? In this book, the implementation of BetrSichV is described specifically with regard to electrical tools, sample forms are provided, and many examples illustrate the problems and opportunities. The parts of BetrSichV and DGUV specification 3 / TRBS that are important for the electrical specialist are completely reproduced in the book.
content.title_en: BetrSichV - the responsible electrical specialist in the obligation : legally secure implementation of the revised operating safety regulation (BetrSichV) in electrical engineering

content.text: Applied statistics : Method collection with R. The freely usable program R is an easy-to-learn and flexible tool for data analysis. The book illustrates the application using simple but demanding examples. Statistical methods are explained and necessary details for data acquisition, analysis and interpretation are provided. New in the 14th edition are sections on Bayes estimation and for the evaluation of repeated measurements, further recommendations for planning and evaluation of scientific studies and a more detailed factual index. (Source: www.buchhandel.de 09.01.2012)
content.title_en: Applied statistics : Method collection with R

content.text: In this book, Geitmann wants to explain the possibilities that hydrogen can bring as fuel of the future. He pays special attention to the use of liquid hydrogen in fuel cells, but also to its combustion in conventional engines. More ambitious but understandable research projects, such as hydrogen storage, are also described. Further chapters are devoted to the production of hydrogen, transport, fuelling and economic aspects. An extensive annex with numerous literature, tables and similar features completes the work. Similar to M. Pehnt (BA 1/03), which deals with the subject even more popular and less scientific. (2)
content.title_en: Hydrogen & fuel cells : the technology of tomorrow!

content.text: The textbook, based on many years of experience in university teaching, provides students of physics and related sciences with an application-oriented presentation of the canonical topics of the introductory mathematics events, which were discussed in the first year of study. The work, which is based on numerous examples and explanatory illustrations, is consistently geared towards the target group. A stringent deductive and proof-complete development of the terms, methods and concepts is dispensed with in favour of a presentation that is consistently oriented towards the possibilities of application and the relevance of natural sciences and is deliberately derived from the perspective of a physicist. The modular structure allows for a point-to-point access to certain contents. The target group also, for example, in addition to the work of Christian B. Lang (ID-G 2/06), provides a teaching book with a practical and in conjunction with the more comprehensive and methodical work of H. Kerner (ID-G 13/06). With tasks and complete solutions. (3) (Philip Kastendieck) The textbook provides students of physics and related physics with a presentation of the case studies on the subject-oriented physics.
content.title_en: Introduction course Mathematics and Mathematics Methods : for students of physics and other mathematical and natural sciences

content.text: Man-made fibres for technical textile products: standard types, modifications, areas of application. Publisher's text: Man-made fibres and the yarns and textile surfaces they produce have a high share of the technical progress in a wide range of industries, whether textile products for automotive, textile filter materials and packaging or for use in construction, earth and water. The aim of this book is to show the diversity and quality of industrial products in which man-made fibres play a decisive role, apart from home textiles and clothing. Here, chemical and high-tech fibres as well as man-made fibre yarns and surfaces are described, technical textile products from different sectors are shown in a selection and research results and pilot projects presented. Readers: textile engineers, technicians, designers, product developers, commercial staff of textile manufacturing and processing companies, young people in these professions for training and further training.
content.title_en: Man-made fibres for technical textile products : standard types, modifications, applications

content.text: Algorithmic Mathematics. The work, based on a basic lecture, provides students with a compact introduction to algorithmic mathematics, preferably during the first semester. Review (ekz): The continuous increasing presence of powerful computers increases the importance of algorithmic mathematics. It deals with the design and analysis as well as the implementation of algorithms and the development and investigation of underlying mathematical structures. This work, based on an introductory lecture, now provides students of mathematics with a compact introduction to algorithmic mathematics, preferably during the first semester. The presentation, which is provided with numerous examples and illustrations, provides the contents mathematically based and at the same time provides a small introduction to the programming language C++, in which the implementation of numerous algorithms is also carried out. Knowledge beyond school knowledge is not necessary. Nevertheless, basic competences in dealing with algorithms and initial solid experiences with university mathematics make reading easier. The target group for the acquisition of basic knowledge in the field of algorithmic mathematics very useful. (3) No tasks.
content.title_en: Algorithmic Mathematics

content.text: Apostoloff : Roman. "A book that, if you want, can be read as a literary road movie - if you remember how often German literature of our time has served on the way as a catalyst for processes of discharge. The narrator in "Apostoloff" is ridding herself of the father or at least of his remains." (Julia Schröder)
content.title_en: Apostoloff : Roman

content.text: Right-wing extremism: Prevention and intervention : an overview of approaches, findings and development needs. The volume provides an overview of key aspects of prevention and intervention against right-wing extremism as well as in-depth information and suggestions for reflection and further technical development of existing practical approaches.
content.title_en: Right-wing extremism: prevention and intervention : an overview of approaches, findings and development needs

content.text: Feedback : how feedback determines our lives and dominates nature, technology, society and economy. Self-referencing and coupling are universal mechanisms in the behavior of systems. Only when one has the backlash of a structural element in mind can one gain real understanding and forecasts - whether it is a pocket watch, the money quantity or the political relations. This applies to natural sciences and technology as well as to psychology, economics and politics. The continuous everyday reference makes the representation vivid, what could have been increased with additional illustrations. Anecdotes, the hypothetical dialogue with the reader and the humor of the author provide for entertaining reading pleasure. An interdisciplinary non-fiction book, which also enriches smaller collections. (1 S)
content.title_en: Feedback : how feedback determines our lives and dominates nature, technology, society and economy

content.text: "Sustainability does not come to zero - not even in what we wear on the skin. The already ecologically worrying cotton becomes more expensive and scarcer. The age of cheap T-shirts is coming to an end - an exciting outlook."-- Due to many years of activity in the textile industry, Engelhardt has sound expertise in the global textile market. His focus is therefore not only on cotton, as the unfortunately misleading title suggests, but also on other natural and synthetic textile fibres. He deals with the importance of the various fibres for the future development of the industry. He considers aspects such as sustainability and environmental impact, durability and suitability, e.g. for sportswear or airbag, but also the consequences of agricultural subsidies in the industrial countries for African small farmers, all underpinned by statistical data. While he predicts the cotton a decreasing importance, he sees a strong trend towards products made of cellulose fibres and polyester. This view on developments in the textile industry is not comparable to the cultural and economic view of Thioli'n's "Rivdton" (Mübergutung-Beitung).
content.title_en: Black Book Cotton : what we really wear on the skin

content.text: Statistics and intuition: Everyday examples critically questioned. Verl.Beschr.: This non-fiction book shows how statistical thinking can succeed and lead to more competence in dealing with uncertainty. Deeply anchored thinking habits make us intuitively look for truths and patterns in everyday life, IBM does not search for probabilities as statistics provide. The book explains how thinking patterns of statisticians and non-statisticians differ, what misunderstandings arise from them and what statistics have to do with truth. It thus promotes IBM's active and mature approach to statistics using practical examples from everyday life and shows how to interpret and communicate statistical statements correctly. A current focus is on big data and the associated data journalism
content.title_en: Statistics and intuition: everyday examples critically questioned

content.text: Selection and design of cables and cables. Guidance for learners and practitioners; with automatic calculation tables on the CD-ROM. (LK/W: Weinheimer-Hartmann) "This guide provides a technical and standard-oriented guide for selecting cables and cables and their calculation ...", as in the discussions on the 1st and 2nd edition (BA 8/04 and 2/08). The 6th edition is again extended to the previous edition at almost the same price. New are now a chapter on neutral conductor reduction and 1 or 2 further automatic tables as help with the calculations on the attached mini CD. Furthermore, the references to standards, regulations and guidelines as well as further literature have been updated or the contents revised accordingly. Since there is - possibly apart from the bfe learning program "cables and cables" (ID-G 25/11) - nothing comparable - the exchange of all pre-conditions and a first purchase are recommended. (2) (LK/W: Weinheimer-Hartmann)
content.title_en: Selection and design of cables and cables

content.text: The present textbook is a compact introduction to the theory of measurement and integration for students of mathematics after the beginner lectures. The concentrated presentation provides a coherent and transparent system of the most important results also for readers who need the theory as a basis for other sub-areas and therefore demand a concise compilation of the central facts. However, the presentation in depth, scope and content is oriented towards the Bachelor's degree programme, in which the study plans are increasingly taking into account the theory of measurement and integration as a mandatory event. The work is well suited for the teaching of the basics, can replace more comprehensive works such as those of Heinz Bauer (last ID 19/91) or Jürgen Elstrodt (last ID 15/03). With tasks (without solutions) and due to the scope only few examples. For stocks with corresponding target groups broadly, otherwise recommended. (3)
content.title_en: Measure and integral

content.text: Linguistics for cognitive science: an interdisciplinary supplement to the introduction to linguistics. How does language work in the brain? What do natural languages have to do with computers? How can words structure our knowledge and thinking? What is the relationship between language and music? Communicate animals differently than humans? Do we need a body to speak? The present study book explains step by step and in an understandable way how current research results of linguistics can help answer such questions of cognitive science. Various approaches are systematically compared to enable an understanding of the interrelations of the diverse research topics and traditions. The study book is suitable for beginners as well as for interested advanced students.
content.title_en: Linguistics for cognitive science : an interdisciplinary supplement to the introduction to linguistics

content.text: Sustainability controlling : Strategies, goals, implementation. bookkatalog.de: How sustainable business can be achieved: This book offers decision-makers a practical introduction to the concepts and methods. Step by step, it explains how the sustainability strategy is integrated into companies and with which instruments controlling accompanies this process. The various controlling tools are discussed in detail, as well as special challenges and possible solutions. Practical examples and a case study make this book a valuable guide in the implementation of sustainable management
content.title_en: Sustainability controlling : strategies, goals, implementation

content.text: The energy-efficient university campus: pilot projects of the EnEff:Stadt research initiative. The EnEff:Stadt initiative supports innovative research projects with the aim of reducing the energy consumption of urban districts. In addition to the development of new technologies and planning tools, pilot projects are supported in the integral planning, implementation and metrological evaluation of urban districts. A special group of projects are the campus projects. Within the research initiative there are currently four ongoing projects, which aim to significantly reduce the energy consumption of a university campus. They are described and compared in this publication.
content.title_en: The energy-efficient university campus: pilot projects of the EnEff:Stadt research initiative

content.text: Electromobility in municipalities - a mood picture : Results of the Difu survey in 2014. Even if the Federal Government's goal of seeing one million electric vehicles on Germany's roads in five years is far from being achieved - 78 percent of the German municipalities surveyed are dealing with the topic of electromobility. This is a result of the Difu survey "Electromobility in municipalities". In this context, the municipalities differ in the nature and scope of the activities and their motivations to deal with this topic. For some municipalities, electromobility is part of an environmentally friendly mobility that is one of the core objectives of a strategic city and transport development. Others tend to look at the topic from the point of view of economic promotion or thus promise to gain an image and positive impact on their urban location.
content.title_en: Electromobility in municipalities - a mood picture : Results of the Difu City Survey 2014

content.text: Regenerative energy systems : Technology - Calculation - Simulation : with 271 colored images, 113 tables and a DVD. Textbook for students and engineers at universities and universities as well as in research and teaching on the entire range of renewable energies. Treats the problem of energy supply and gives hints on future trends. An accompanying DVD-ROM with a collection of demo programs and full versions for the simulation of renewable energy systems is a DVD-ROM. In addition, pictures as copy templates and additional photos. Has been extended compared to the 2nd edition 1999 (ID 9/00) by approx. 120 pages and improved in the equipment (contains now continuous color illustrations).
content.title_en: Renewable energy systems : Technology - Calculation - Simulation : with 271 colored images, 113 tables and a DVD

content.text: Lenin's train: the journey into the revolution. The author describes one of the most successful train journeys in world history, the legendary journey of Lenin with some companions from Zurich to Petrograd. She reconstructs the journey filigree and corrects many errors in the literature so far. Review: We follow the author (lastly in 2014) on one of the most successful train journeys in world history, the journey of Lenin with some companions from Zurich via Germany to Petrograd. It was World War and so a tour difficult to organize. All kinds of stripping had to be drawn, ID cards and stamps prepared on time and the financing clarified. The English historian reconstructs the journey filigree and corrects many errors in the previous literature, among other things on the itinerary. She describes the intermediate stations of the train journey and lets the revolution happenings, which Lenin strives towards, step into the last stage of the process. Thus, a kind of historical guide for the journey to the October Revolution was created. German politicians and officers hoped that the revolutionary would overthrow the Tsar and Russia from the war. In the so-called "Spirative" Lenin's pages were depicted.
content.title_en: Lenin's Train: the Journey to the Revolution

content.text: The construction of a passive house is becoming increasingly economical when energy prices rise and the basic prices of improved technical components and components fall. Compared to the first edition of 2002 (BA 1/03 - can be used up) the construction of a passive house is being updated in technical and legal developments, supplemented by Internet addresses and extended by a chapter with 4 exemplary, innovative passive house concepts. Even for smaller libraries before the significantly more expensive C. Grobe "Plan and build passive houses" (BA 4/03), before the sample collections "New passive houses" (ID 6/04), "Grosse Passive houses" (ID 8/06), "Effective use of energy - the best single-family houses" (BA 12/02) and after Th. Königstein: "Ratgeer energy-saving building" (see this no.) (2).
content.title_en: Basics and construction of a passive house

content.text: Learning tourism regions: networking as a strategic success factor for small and medium-sized enterprises. By providing resources for small and medium-sized tourist enterprises (SMEs) with a space for cooperation or networking and mutual knowledge exchange, a learning region is created: it provides pooled and accessible resources for SMEs and thus strengthens their competitiveness and marketability. These relationships have been discovered in an analysis of two tourism regions. At the same time, obstacles to the establishment of a learning tourism region have been highlighted. A prototype of a learning region shows with which instruments these obstacles can be overcome.
content.title_en: Learning tourism regions: networking as a strategic success factor for small and medium-sized enterprises

content.text: Deep Learning : the comprehensive manual: basics, current procedures and algorithms, new research approaches. Mathematical basics for machine and deep learning. Comprehensive treatment of modern methods: deep feed forward networks, regularization, performance optimization as well as CNNs, recursive and recursive neural networks. Future-oriented deep learning approaches as well as concepts developed by Ian Goodfellow such as Generative Adversarial Networks. Deep Learning is a sub-area of machine learning and enables computers to learn from experience. This book comprehensively covers all aspects that play a role in the use and application of deep learning: in Part I, the authors explain the mathematical basics for artificial intelligence, neural networks, machine learning and deep learning. In Part II, the current methods and algorithms used in practice are dealt with. In Part III, the authors provide insight into current research approaches and show new forward-looking methods. This book is aimed at students and all those who are engaged in research with deep learning as well as software developers and computer scientists who want to use basic knowledge and programming in the fields of mathematics.
content.title_en: Deep Learning : the comprehensive manual : basics, current procedures and algorithms, new research approaches

content.text: Our society is a service society. But what do we mean by "performance"? How did performance become a supposedly objective, individual size and how did it change social relationships and feelings? Why do people define themselves about their performance - or about what they and others think it is? Nina Verheyen describes how the understanding of performance has changed and tells the story of an idea that shapes our lives. She pleads for a historically informed and at the same time new, more social definition of performance, which can be convincingly argued against optimization constraints, market mechanisms and social inequality.
content.title_en: The invention of the benefit

content.text: Internet Internals : Intermediation layer, structure and protocols. The author has been working at the Hochschule für angewandte Wissenschaften München for many years. His textbook "Grundkurs Datenkommunikation : TCP/IP-based Kommunikation: Grundlagen, Konzep und Standarden" (Basic Course Data Communication: TCP/IP-based Communication: Basics, Concepts and Standards) was published in 2010. He has now broken this work down into two individual books and expanded it considerably. The first part was published in the previous year under the title "TCP and UDP Internals". Here follows part 2, which is certainly more expensive than part 1. Students and network administrators get practical access to the topics of Intermediation layer and Internet protocols IPv4 and IPv6, but also find many other control and configuration protocols. The NAT (Network Address Translation) program is also extensively discussed. It is still important to avoid an address shortage at IPv4 and protect private networks.
content.title_en: Internet Internals : Intermediation, structure and protocols

content.text: Net feminism : Strategies of female image politics. Pink-coloured slips, baby blue colored armpit hair, Schmollmünder on selfies: What sounds like male fantasies is feminist statement among net artists. They enter the battleground for the "right" image of women, which is not only metaphorically debated in the social media. Is a woman emancipatory when she shows herself while breastfeeding - or does she reduce herself and other women to the mother role? Does a "Girl Power" T-shirt confirm the role of the naive little girl - or does it question her? The media scientist Annekathrin Kohout has written an equally short and concise cultural and discourse history of female image politics, which from the emancipation movements in the early 20th century to the netfeminist image dispute of the present takes into account all the essential phenomena of female image politics
content.title_en: Net feminism : strategies of female image politics

content.text: We think, so I am: about knowledge and knowledge illusions. Our brain can produce ingenious insights, but can also fail miserably and make a lot of mistakes. How can this be? ask the two renowned US cognitive scientists and describe the thinking processes in us in detail, especially the social dimension of our thinking, i.e. the interplay of brain and its respective environment - scientifically accurate, but without many technical terms, with numerous examples of human misperformances and catastrophic errors from politics, society and everyone's everyday life, also written quite fluidly.
content.title_en: We think so I am : about knowledge and knowledge illusions

content.text: Introduction to the statistical evaluation of experiments : Theory and practice with R. Verl.Beschr.: This textbook provides a variety of tools for the analysis of experiments: It shows the basics of the evaluation of factorial experimental plans by means of one or more factorial variance analyses (ANOVA) as well as by means of common nonparametric alternatives. Furthermore, methods for the verification of the assumptions of variance analyses are presented. The individual methods are motivated first by clear examples and data sets, presented and calculated with paper and pen. For larger examples the freely available statistical software R is used, with which the manual calculations can be completed and finally also larger data sets can be evaluated.
content.title_en: Introduction to the statistical evaluation of experiments : theory and practice with R

content.text: IT manual for computer specialists: the training companion. The current 9th edition (8th edition 2017) of the IT manual provides practical instructions for the training and everyday work in the professions computer specialists application development and system integration, IT system electronics, IT system merchants and computer specialists. The work includes not only the technical and theoretical details but also practical application examples. The author has taken care to choose software from the open source area. If the work is constantly being developed, it has been adapted and updated to the latest developments in the IT field. Added to this book: new Java features, graphs and the introduction to the Decorator pattern and to work with the Continuous Integration Toll Jenkins. Chapter 20 has a new sub-chapter "The JavaScript Library React.js". The work has 66 pages more and is somewhat more expensive than the predecessor. Solutions to the tasks and control questions as well as the source code of the programming examples are available on the publisher's website.
content.title_en: IT manual for IT specialists : the training assistant

content.text: Smart Cities : German high technology for the city of the future. Global urbanization is a key challenge of the 21st century. Since 2007, more people have lived in urban areas than in rural areas, and in 2030 it will be 60 percent. Cities and agglomerations are therefore dependent on networked technologies. "Smart technologies offer answers in different areas of need. Germany in particular has good opportunities to establish itself as a leading provider of innovative overall solutions – if the framework conditions are created for this. This opinion was prepared in preparation for the first "Innovation Dialogue between the Federal Government, Business and Science" in September 2010. However, it represents an independent publication of the German Academy of Technology. It provides recommendations for action on how to tap into new value creation opportunities for integrated solutions.
content.title_en: Smart Cities : German high technology for the city of the future

content.text: The exit from nuclear power is to be made safe: Why Germany needs nuclear competence for dismantling, reactor safety, final storage and radiation protection. Introduction -- How the safety of nuclear installations can be ensured until they are shut down -- What needs to be done in terms of waste and final storage -- Why radiation protection (at any time) is an important concern – but especially in the dismantling of power plants -- What role research and teaching play for the training of young people -- Outlook: Research from global responsibility and the importance of communication from science -- . Literature list. In response to the accident at the Japanese nuclear power plant Fukushima Daiichi, Germany will be the first industrial country in the world to completely phase out nuclear power within a decade. With the decision to phase out nuclear power plants, Germany will not become nuclear technology-free overnight. Rather, it is important to ensure that nuclear power plants operate at the highest safety standards until the scheduled date of exit in 2022. Moreover, the dismantling of nuclear power plants and the final storage problem that has not been resolved until now, the company's exit from the present phase of nuclear power has taken over decades to the status of the German Academy of use of nuclear power.
content.title_en: Making the exit from nuclear power safe : Why Germany needs nuclear competence for dismantling, reactor safety, final storage and radiation protection

content.text: Cyber-Physical Systems: an innovative motor for mobility, health, energy and production. Already today, around 98 percent of microprocessors work embedded in everyday objects and devices, connected to the outside world via sensors and actuators. Increasingly, they are connected to each other and to the Internet. The physical world merges with the virtual world, cyberspace. Cyber-Physical Systems are emerging. Future cyber-physical systems will contribute in a way that is hardly conceivable to the safety, efficiency, comfort and health of people and thus contribute to the solution of central challenges of our society, such as the ageing population, resource shortage, mobility or energy change. Germany has the opportunity to secure itself in the international competition a leading place with innovative cyber-physical systems. What conditions to create for this and how Germany can overcome the technical, political and social hurdles on the way there, acatech calls in this statement.
content.title_en: Cyber-Physical Systems : Innovation engine for mobility, health, energy and production

content.text: Future Energy Grid : Information and communication technologies for the path to a sustainable and economic energy system. Germany's energy transition can only be achieved with Smart Grids. By 2022, Germany wants to phase out nuclear energy and switch to an energy supply based on renewable energies. These can only be integrated into the electricity system on a large scale using information and communication technologies (ICT). In a so-called Smart Grid, ICT and energy technology merge and ensure sustainable, reliable and affordable electricity – to the advantage of electricity customers, energy producers and the German economy. However, with the conversion of the electricity infrastructure, immense challenges also arise on politics, business, science and the population. With eight theses acatech outlines the future of energy supply in Germany and gives concrete recommendations for the construction of the Future Energy Grid.
content.title_en: Future Energy Grid : Information and communication technologies for the path to a sustainable and economic energy system

content.text: Perspectives of biotechnology communication : Controversies — boundary conditions — formats. Biotechnology, especially genetic engineering, has been the focus of public debate in Germany for almost 40 years. Controversies in society and science, however, do not result in biotechnology as a whole, but in individual applications. Public controversy is too short to interpret as a lack of acceptance, which can be resolved by increasing information. The development and introduction of new technologies presupposes a successful dialogue between science and the public. This acatech POSITION analyses experiences from controversy and communication strategies on green genetic engineering and other fields of biotechnology in communication and social science as well as historical perspectives. acatech provides recommendations on how biotechnology can be communicated in a suitable and balanced way in the future. Introduction -- Biotechnology controversy -- Biotechnology communication: boundary conditions -- Communication and participation -- Conclusion and recommendations.
content.title_en: Perspectives of biotechnology communication : controversy — boundary conditions — formats

content.text: The fascination of construction and the field of activity in the course of change: Recommendations for the training of qualified specialists in Germany. Project -- Introduction -- Seven theses on the training of designers and the profession of constructor -- 3 recommendations. Innovation and high-tech products make Germany one of the leading industrial nations. The development of new and improved products will continue to play an outstanding role in the future, as product development and design contribute to prosperity, economic growth and international competitiveness of Germany. This is a mastery behind every new or customer-adapted product: technical challenges and needs must be recognised. Appropriate technical solutions must be found, which will then be further developed into a functional and industrially manufactured product. No development project is like the other and will enter new territory with each other. These varied but constantly changing but responsible tasks are taken over by constructors in mechanical engineering and in the electrical engineering industry. The training of constructors thus faces major challenges: it must meet the change of the fields of activity and requirements with adapted training concepts, to the handling of continuous development and to be more attractively outlined by constructors.
content.title_en: Fascination Construction — Career and work in transition : Recommendations for the training of qualified professionals in Germany

content.text: Privateness on the Internet: Perceiving opportunities, assessing risks, shaping trust. Fundamental values -- Privateness on the Internet: a challenge -- Theses on the development of a culture of privateness on the Internet -- Recommendations for action -- The next step. With its digital marketplaces, search engines, social networks and many other services, the Internet can contribute to the realization of fundamental European values: free self-determination, political participation and economic well-being of people. However, users often pay Internet services with data instead of money, thereby challenging their privacy. In view of this tension, acatech shows how an Internet culture can be developed that allows them to perceive the opportunities of the Internet while protecting the privateness of people. This achatech position contains concrete recommendations for action, such as education, economy, law and technology, to contribute to such a culture.
content.title_en: Privateness on the Internet: take chances, assess risks, build trust

content.text: Quality assurance of the determination of the air exchange rate in indoor spaces : a comparison of methods : final report. In the context of this research project, existing methods for determining the air exchange rate were compared with different tracer gases. Tracer gases are used as so-called indicator gases for determining the air exchange rate. In accordance with the guideline VDI 4300 sheet 7, various ventilation scenarios investigated how different tracer gases behave under the same spatial conditions and whether there are deviations in the determination of the air exchange rate. In a literature research, the state of science was mapped and examined the health assessment as well as the environmental potential of the tracer gases used.
content.title_en: Quality assurance of the determination of the air exchange rate in indoor spaces : a comparison of methods : final report

metadata.authors: Neuweger, Britta; Hutter-Sumowski, Chris Vanessa; Meyer, Alina; Weis, Norbert

content.text: Pharmaceutical residues in recyclates of phosphorus recovery from sewage sludges : Final report. Currently there are data gaps on pharmaceutical residues in sewage sludges and phosphorus recycling products produced from them (P-recyclates). The aim of the project was to investigate phosphorus recovery and carbonisation plants in Germany with regard to the following medicines ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, clarithromycin, carbamazepine, 17-α-ethinylestradiol, diclofenac, cefuroxim, sulfamethoxazole, 17-β-estradiol, metoprolol and bezafibrate. The study clearly shows that phosphorus recovery processes significantly reduce the drug exposure in P-recyclates compared to the raw materials such as sewage sludge. The results were discussed at a technical workshop.
content.title_en: Residues of pharmaceutical products in recycates of phosphorus recovery from sewage sludge : Final report

metadata.authors: Eißing, Michael; Wiesgickl, Sonja; Mundt, Matthias; Stenzel, Fabian; Jung, Rolf; Dexheimer, Kai

content.text: Current developments and prospects of biogas production from biowaste and manure : Final report. Sludge and biowaste still cause relevant greenhouse gas emissions due to the necessary storage, treatment and recovery. They are already used in biogas plants to provide renewable energy. However, there are still potential for expansion for this use route. However, the mobilisation of the material flows seems to be extremely complex and difficult. Therefore, this project report presents the state of knowledge in order to identify existing barriers and possibilities of mobilising manure and biowaste for biogas production and derive from these practical proposals for action. Among other things, a proposal for adapting the EEG funding, which is intended to stimulate the use of manure in biogas plants more strongly, has been developed, but also pointed out that, according to the polluter principle, measures in agriculture should be considered. Proposals for the increased use of biowaste in fermentation plants, for example, relate to the increased collection of biomaterials separately, the promotion of biowaste fermentation plants within the framework of the EEG and support for municipalities.
content.title_en: Current development and prospects of biogas production from biowaste and manure : Final report

content.text: In the context of the 1990 reform, the German Government should be able to significantly reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption, to reduce the burden of energy consumption and to reform energy prices: ways to achieve cross-sectoral market design. How should the market design be designed to enable efficient climate protection in Germany and to promote sector coupling? An essential component is comprehensive carbon pricing and a reform of taxes, levies and levies. This opinion sets the decisions of the 2030 Climate Package and shows options for how to use the revenues from CO2 pricing to achieve a double dividend for climate protection. The following points are crucial: A uniform and comprehensive carbon price in Europe should be the core of an efficient and effective market design.
content.title_en: CO2 prices, energy prices reform: ways to create cross-sectoral market design

content.text: HeatResilientCity : heat-resilient urban and district development in large cities : Results report for the 2018 survey in Erfurt. This survey report was developed as part of the subproject 7 of the BMBF-Verbundforschungsprojekt "HeatResilientCity - heat-resilient urban and district development in large cities - resident-oriented knowledge generation and implementation".
content.title_en: HeatResilientCity : heat-resilient urban and district development in major cities : Results report for the 2018 survey in Erfurt

content.text: The impact of digitisation and big data analysis on the sustainable environment and the environment. The aim is to identify and analyse the current developments in digitalisation and to assess the impact of digitalisation on the future. The second step is to identify and assess the opportunities and risks that arise from the analysis. In this context, the analysis of the behaviour of different user groups will be particularly relevant to the impact of digitalisation on the environment and climate.
content.title_en: The impact of digitisation and big data analysis on the sustainable development of tourism and its environmental impact : final report

content.text: Stainless steel in infrastructure: bridges from all over the world. Worldwide there are hundreds of thousands of bridges, around 120,000 are on German federal highways, rural roads and municipal roads – and there are increasing numbers. Bridge constructions are an essential part of the transport infrastructure and basic prerequisite for private mobility, but also for the smooth transport of goods and the provision of services. ... The applications documented in this brochure show the use of stainless steels in bridges for road, pedestrian, railway and bicycle traffic as well as combined use. The locations are located in hot and cold climate zones, inland as well as in coastal regions.
content.title_en: Stainless steel in infrastructure : bridges from all over the world

content.text: Future market decentralized water treatment and rainwater management : case study on behalf of the Federal Environment Agency within the framework of the research project "Innovative environmental policy in important fields of action" (funding code 206 14 132/05). Stronger semi- or decentralized concepts of water supply and wastewater disposal infrastructure are of particular importance in view of the insinuating climate change and foreseeable demographic changes, as they can be better adapted to changing challenges than the prevailing central infrastructure. Important building blocks are the treatment and (re)use of rain and grey water. On the one hand, rainwater management can reduce the environmental burden by heavy precipitation and the groundwater can be renewed by decentralized leaching. On the other hand, membrane technology plays a key role in the treatment of all types of raw and waste water.
content.title_en: Future market decentralized water treatment and rainwater management : case study on behalf of the Federal Environment Agency within the framework of the research project "Innovative environmental policy in important fields of action" (mark 206 14 132/05)

This survey report was developed within the framework of the subproject 7 of the BMBF-Verbundforschungsprojekt „HeatResilientCity - Heat-resilient urban and district development in large cities - Resident-oriented knowledge generation and implementation.
content.title_en: Perspectives of municipal actors on climate adaptation to heat : Results report of stakeholder and governance analysis and recommendations for action for municipalities

content.text: Digital transformation, work and health: Interdisciplinary knowledge, operational practice and tools for human-centered work design. Digital transformation is changing the working world. How is digitalization implemented in a health-oriented way in small and medium-sized enterprises? The current state of knowledge is summarised with detailed insights into the practice and tools for managing business digitization projects.The content of digitalization and Industry 4.0 - Opportunities for human-centered work design Change in qualification requirements, health loads and resources Design knowledge and tools: prevention instruments and over-company concepts The target groups practitioners in companies, operating doctors, works councils, trade unions Work/health researchers, students Technology/industry networks The editors Thomas Engel, Head of ZeTT – Center Digital Transformation Thuringia, Friedrich-Schiller-Universität Jena, is researching on the change of work and employment in digitalization. Christian Erfurt, Professor of Informatics, Ernst-Abbe-Hochschule Jena, is working on the technological and organizational design possibilities of the digital working environment. Stephanie Drösssler works at the Institute and Poliklinik für Arbeits- und Sozialmedizin der Medizinischen Fakultät der TU Dresden on health and prevention in the digital transformation.
content.title_en: Digital transformation, work and health : Interdisciplinary knowledge, operational practice and tools for human-centered work design

content.text: PORTAL GREEN : Development of a Power-to-Gas Guide to the Integration of Renewable Energies. Storage and use electricity from renewable energies as hydrogen in a variety of ways: The term Power-to-Gas is an important technology to achieve climate objectives. However, inconsistent specifications and lack of experience with the new application sometimes cause headaches for those responsible if they plan and want to put power-to-gas systems into operation. Researchers in the project Portal Green offer a guide to decision-making for free download. This guide is intended to guide companies and authorities, help them, guide them, guide them and manage what procedures and laws need to be observed if they want to build and operate power-to-gas plants.
content.title_en: PORTAL GREEN : Development of a Power-to-Gas Guide to the Integration of Renewable Energy

content.text: Guide to optical 3D measurement technology. The "Guide to optical 3D measurement technology" provides an overview of optical 3D measurement technology. Typical methods and methods, such as strip projection, light cut or white light interferometry, are presented. The practical application spectrum of optical 3D measurement technology, especially in the quality assurance in manufacturing, is described on the basis of realized applications, also taking into account standards and guidelines. Knowledge and knowledge about application possibilities, performance and limits of modern measurement and testing technology with image processing are an important prerequisite for the successful use of these systems and technologies in industrial production and quality assurance. The Fraunhofer Business Area Vision's Guide series aims to contribute to this. Every year, a volume on a relevant topic complex from the field of image processing appears, in which the respective state of the art is presented in a general and vivid manner. Potential users are thus to be facilitated the first entry into the topic. The "Guide to optical 3D measurement technology" is published as an updated and extended new edition.
content.title_en: Guide to optical 3D measurement technology

content.text: Bauhaus 2050 : Final report of the Bauhaus 2050 research project: Energetic urban renovation to reduce CO2 emissions, taking into account listed buildings in Weimar. In the research project "Bauhaus2050: Energetic urban renovation to reduce CO2 emissions, taking into account listed buildings in Weimar", the optimisation potential of educational buildings in relation to the potential for renovation of building envelopes and energy systems under the objective of the Federal Government's climate protection programme was analysed
content.title_en: Bauhaus 2050 : Final report of the Bauhaus 2050 research project: Energetic urban renovation to reduce CO2 emissions, taking into account listed buildings in Weimar

content.text: The survey analyses the proportion of plug-in electric vehicles (PEV) benefits in Germany, the amount of renewable electricity to be purchased via corresponding supply contracts and the way this can be assessed. The analysis shows that for all charging locations - at home, at work and at public fast and slow charging stations - the proportion of green electricity contracts is very high (>75 %). Especially when charging at home, what is the most common charging location, the proportion of green electricity contracts by PEV beneficiaries (84%) is well above that in German households (30%). However, the different green electricity contracts differ significantly in their ecological requirements. However, the knowledge about this seems rather low among PEV beneficiaries.
content.title_en: Charging of electric vehicles in Germany with green electricity contracts

content.text: The present study examines Germany's technological performance in an international comparison. It shows that the German economy has a relatively strong overall specialisation in research-intensive industries and knowledge-intensive services. However, in the case of knowledge-intensive services, which is a major driver of growth in value added and employment in all countries, Germany has some weaknesses. This is particularly true in view of labour productivity, which has declined between 1995 and 2015, and is significantly below the level of productivity of knowledge-intensive services in other countries. German foreign trade in research-intensive goods has significantly collapsed as a result of the Corona pandemic. The decline in foreign trade is mainly due to the high-quality trade in motor vehicles and accessories, which was severely affected by supply chain problems. Although the consideration of foreign trade specialisation with research-intensive goods shows a declining trend in the medium term, the comparative advantages could still be almost stable during the Corona pandemic.
content.title_en: R & D-intensive industries and knowledge-intensive services in an international comparison

content.text: The aim of this study is to carry out an economic and ecological assessment for alternative fuels and drives for compact-class vehicles in Germany for 2020 and 2030. The economic assessment is based on a total cost-of-ownership approach, without imposing taxes, taxes and subsidies. The ecological assessment is based on the Life Cycle Assessment approach. Battery-electric mobility will probably play the most important role in the field of car drive change by 2030 and beyond. It is already available to a large extent commercially. It is the most economical and energy-efficient of the mitigation options available with high potential. The challenge is that the speed of market penetration is set certain limits. Plug-in hybrids can also be a bridge function. Other options, especially biogas and synthetic fuels, can contribute to reducing the greenhouse gas emissions in passenger cars by 2030 by limiting potential and high costs at a low level. In the long term, fuel cell cars could also be a supplement.
content.title_en: Long-term environmental assessment and potential for alternative propulsion technologies

content.text: Investigation and further development of a process for the biological enrichment of methane of biogas by means of an innovative bed bed process (internal and external biological enrichment of methane by the bed method – an upgrade for conventional biogas plants) : Final report. A possibility to improve the utilization rate of seasonal and weather-related fluctuating electricity generation from renewable energy sources is the Power-to-Gas strategy. Here, electrical energy, ideally "over-power electricity, is transferred into a chemical form (hydrogen). This transformation step thus enables the storage of the electrical energy which is not removable from the electricity grid. Moreover, the feed into the natural gas network results in the possibility to distribute this energy in a surface-covering manner. However, due to the chemical and physical properties of hydrogen, this process is not unlimited, therefore a further conversion into the energy carrier methane is sought.
content.title_en: Investigation and further development of a process for the biological enrichment of methane of biogas by means of an innovative bed-bed process (internal and external biological enrichment of methane by the bed-bed process – an upgrade for classic biogas plants) : Final report

content.text: Final report for the study and further development of a process for the biological enrichment of methane of biogas by means of an innovative belt bed process (internal and external biological enrichment of methane by the belt bed method – an upgrade for conventional biogas plants). One way to improve the utilization rate of seasonal and weather-related fluctuating electricity generation from renewable energy sources is the Power-to-Gas strategy. In this process, electrical energy, ideally "over-power electricity", is transferred into a chemical form (hydrogen). This transformation step thus enables the storage of the electrical energy which is not acceptable from the electricity grid. Moreover, the feed into the natural gas network gives the possibility to distribute this energy over the surface. However, due to the chemical and physical properties of hydrogen, this recovery route is not unlimited, therefore a further conversion into the energy carrier methane is sought.
content.title_en: Final report for the study and further development of a process for the biological enrichment of biogas by means of an innovative bed-bed process (internal and external biological enrichment by the bed-bed process – an upgrade for classic biogas plants)

content.text: Are substances more persistent than the test systems? : Review of the persistence assessment using the example of hydrolysis. Hydrolysis is a crucial process for the degradation of many water-soluble substances in the environment. Hydrolysis studies with new substances are currently conducted in pure water. Hydrolysis is an abiotic process that is crucial for the fat of many water-soluble substances in an aquatic environment. The ability of chemicals to undergo hydrolysis is currently tested in purified lab water in accordance with OECD productline 111.
content.title_en: Are substances more persistent than the test systems suggest? : Review of the test systems for persistence assessment using the example of hydrolysis

content.text: The final report of the project TaBuLa-LOG. In the project TaBuLa-LOG, the component of the freight transport was built on the results of the previous project »Test center for automated buses in the district duchy of Lauenburg« (TaBuLa) and added the component of goods transport to the functioning automated shuttle service. The further development of pure passenger transport towards a combination of passenger and goods mobility was tested in order to examine the previous, often singular concentration on separate systems against the background of resource bundling for automated means of transport. In more rural regions, the behaviour of the behaviour of the various factors of the traffic to a different system.
content.title_en: Final report of the project TaBuLa-LOG

content.text: Options for importing green hydrogen to Germany by 2030 : Material band. Hydrogen is a key element in achieving climate neutrality. It is an important complement to direct electrification, especially for decarbonisation of industry and certain transport sectors. Importes will be necessary to meet the high future needs. It is important to learn from the past and to minimize dependence. In an analysis, the ESYS experts show transport options and their advantages and disadvantages and describe obstacles and challenges for the construction of transport chains and hydrogen cooperations.
content.title_en: Options for importing green hydrogen to Germany by 2030 : Materialband

Detlef Schulz. This volume is dedicated in particular to the analysis, digitization and flexibilization of energy markets, electromobility, sector coupling, electrical energy networks and hydrogen systems. The contributions are assigned to the following five chapters: 1. Flexibilisation of tomorrow's energy markets 2. Increasing the adaptability of the mobility sector from the point of view of load and charging management 3. Digitization of sector coupling of distribution and island networks 4. Analysis of energy networks and systems 5. Aspects of hydrogen systems in the future energy supply.

content.text: Reallabor „Eckernförderung Bay 2030-E : Final report : Project start: 01.04.2021, Duration: 12 months (+ 2 months extension). The EU Marine Strategy Framework Directive (EU-MSRL) provides for "to reach or maintain a good state of the marine environment" by 2020. This top goal is not yet achieved for the Baltic Sea. High nutrient input still ensures strong eutrophication, and human activities (e.g. fishing and tourism) affect marine species and habitats. At the same time, many user groups with sometimes opposing interests are affected by the topics, e.g. fisheries, agriculture, tourism or coastal protection. Thus, eutrophication effects due to strong algae increase also have negative consequences for tourism. The overall goal is to improve the ecological condition of the Baltic Sea's Schleswig-Holstein coastal waters and thus support the implementation of the EU-MSRL, therefore requires a cross-sectoral approach, in which both different scientific disciplines and various social stakeholders are involved.
content.title_en: Reallabor „Eckernförderung Bay 2030-: Final report : Project start: 01.04.2021, Duration: 12 months (+ 2 months extension)

content.text: Determination of the hygienic and microbial load limits of a drinking water dam : BMBF research project Measures to eliminate the use-restricting quality properties of standing waters ; Final report, duration: 1 March 1993 to 30 June 1996. In this report, the stress situation of a dam system with bacteria, parasites, phytoplankton, plant nutrients and plant protection products (PBSM) is investigated, which are registered from the catchment area in accordance with hydrological seasonal characteristics.
content.title_en: Determination of the hygienic and microbial limits of a drinking water dam : BMBF research project Measures to eliminate water quality restrictions ; Final report, duration: 1 March 1993 to 30 June 1996

content.text: The Höglwald project is a phase of cooling down the Höglwald project - late consequences of acidic irrigation and lime: Final report on the research project. Since 1984, the effects of acidic irrigation and lime on a well-growing spruce-old population have been examined in an interdisciplinary manner in the Höglwald forest between Munich and Augsburg. The main objective of the Höglwald project is to examine interdisciplinary and ecologically comprehensively under realistic open-air conditions to what extent spruce forests are damaged by acid ingestion and whether possible damage to mttel's compensatory lime can be prevented ...
content.title_en: The Höglwald project - late consequences of acidic irrigation and lime: Final report on the research project

content.text: Mediterranean: [Geography, History, Economy, Politics] : with 29 tables. Folding text: For the first time, a comprehensive country-wide survey of the entire Mediterranean is presented. The author shows the historical, demographic, economic, ecological, social and political networks and works out strengths and weaknesses, risks and opportunities of the individual regions. With many color illustrations and photos, the book is also suitable for travellers looking for background information.
content.title_en: Mediterranean : [Geography, history, economy, politics] : with 29 tables
