content.title_en: Defending freedom: how we win the fight for open society

content.text: ExpRessBio - Methods : Methods for the analysis and evaluation of selected ecological and economic effects of product systems from agricultural and forestry raw materials. The "Expert Group Resource Management Bioenergy in Bavaria - ExpRessBio" sets out harmonised "Methods for the analysis and evaluation of selected ecological and economic effects of product systems from agricultural and forestry raw materials" in Bavaria for the first time with the TFZ report 45. This has created an essential basis for obtaining harmonised, comparable and transparent balance sheet results for all future assessments of agricultural and forestry production in Bavaria. [...] (Source: TFZ)
content.title_en: ExpRessBio - Methods : Methods for analysis and evaluation of selected ecological and economic effects of product systems from agricultural and forestry raw materials

metadata.authors: Klein, Daniel; Engelmann, Karsten; Dressler, Daniela

content.text: Basic knowledge of tourism architecture. Where the next holiday will go depends not only on the climate, the landscape and the service in the hotel, but also on the architecture on site. In addition to the picturesque old town, the focus is on the experiential architecture of hotels, museums and shopping malls. The book outlines architecture as an economic factor in tourism and addresses the tension between destination management and architecture. Also, the staging and artificial adventure worlds, for example in amusement parks, are considered. Urban planning opportunities and risks are also highlighted. Interviews with a hotel manager, a hotel architect and a tourism manager provide the reader with a practical perspective. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Basic knowledge of tourism architecture

content.text: Bioeconomy for beginners. It is likely that the first book in the German-speaking world can be regarded as a compendium for the entry into the bioeconomy. Bioeconomy - that is connected with nothing less than the long-term survival of humanity on this earth. It is about the transition from the age of fossil raw materials to a world economy based on renewables. In a factual, ideological and understandable way, the scientific, economic and ecological challenges and backgrounds are discussed. In the 10 chapters, the numerous authors explore the questions of biomass and its use, biotechnology and innovation, the circular economy and sustainability and also discuss problems of economic and consumer growth. The abundance of information makes reading exciting and interesting, countless graphs illustrate the correlations. (2-3)
content.title_en: Bioeconomy for beginners

content.text: Digital and Web Analytics : Evaluate metrics, understand visitor behaviour, optimize website. Introduction to the analysis and interpretation of metrics with the aim of optimizing the Internet presence. First, it explains how digital analytics systems work and a data collection is stored and evaluated. Broadly speaking, the observation of visitor behaviour, the use of content and digital channels takes place. At the end, the optimization of the website is the result. (2-3)
content.title_en: Digital and Web Analytics : Evaluate metrics, understand visitor behavior, optimize website

content.text: Commercially operating small-scale electric fleets (GO-ELK) : Final report GO ELK : Reporting period: 01.2013-06.2016. In the joint project "Commercially operating small-scale electric fleets GO ELK!" five commercial fleets were equipped with five electric vehicles, each operated in the "Electromobility Showcase" of the Federal Republic of Germany. Collaborative partners were E.ON New Build & Technology and the Ruhr West University of Applied Sciences. The aim of the research project was to analyse the technological feasibility and economic viability of the use of electric vehicles in commercial fleets. In addition, new business models were developed in the field of electric vehicles, charging infrastructure and mobility. Research aspects included battery age forecasts and charging process optimization for vehicles with high annual mileage throughputs: periodic measurement of vehicles for the determination of the state of health; acquisition and analysis of vehicle telemetry data; ageing of battery cells under laboratory conditions; expansion of vehicle batteries after the operating life cycle with subsequent SoH measurement was also evaluated in the context of the analysis of the user battery.
content.title_en: Commercial small-scale electric fleets (GO-ELK) : Final report GO ELK : Reporting period: 01.2013-06.2016

content.text: Algorithms for dummy. We live in an algorithm-determined world. Therefore it is worth understanding how algorithms work. The book presents the most important areas of application for algorithms: optimization, sorting processes, graph theory, text analysis, hash functions. Each algorithm provides background knowledge and practical basics as well as examples for current applications.
content.title_en: Algorithms for stupides

content.text: Sound design: Sound, perception, emotion. The author describes the emotional effect of sounds, sounds and music and explains the interactions that can arise from the combination of (moving) image and sound. Review: The author uses the term "sound design" to describe the use of auditory elements in media with the aim of generating certain emotions, e.g. in film dialogues, sounds, ambient sounds and music, which all have a communicative content and create emotions. In order to show and analyse the interactions, the physical basics of sound perception are first described, then the meanings of different sounds and sound patterns are explained and illustrated by the examination of individual film scenes. The explanations are detailed and well understandable, but sometimes also quite complex. The grayscale images are well dosed and always used purposefully. Good: Several times the author reproduces small practical exercises in the text, through which a discussed phenomenon can be made concretely audible. The target group of the title are media designers, sound technicians, musicians and directors as well as students of appropriate fields of study.
content.title_en: Sound design : sound, perception, emotion

content.text: 100 years of Red October : on the world history of the Russian Revolution. Eleven authors from six countries try to show "what effect Lenin's overthrow has unfolded in the past century and up to our present." Everyone has set out a decade after that and presents interpretations and controversy. Review: Eleven authors from six countries try to show "what effect Lenin's overthrow has unfolded in the past century and up to our present." Each one has set out a decade after that to examine what traces of this century event were found in the respective period and to show interpretations and controversy that developed increasingly by far. Thus, each essay has a different approach, even through the period (1917, 1927 to 2007, 2017), also in the presentation. It is no history of 1917 and no review of literature. But it has resulted in texts about the October revolution in the 20s, e.g. in the film, the celebrations of 1937, the later references to the Red October under Chrushchev, Brezhnev, Gorbachov, in China and in the collection of the article.
content.title_en: 100 years of Red October : on the world history of the Russian Revolution

content.text: The Break : France's divided society. In statements and interviews from 2015 and 2016, the proven expert of French Islamism comments on the development of our neighbour, as it has been taking place since the attacks under the conditions of siege and social and political polarization. (2-3)
content.title_en: The Break : France's Divided Society

content.text: Legal for webshop operators : the comprehensive manual. The legal companion for your online shop : Legally secure design of your shop pages up to check-out - pitfalls and stumbling blocks in e-commerce law - sample texts, checklists and expert tips from practice. - Selling on the Internet has become a true treadmining field. In every action, the warning of a competitor is almost lurking, and the risk is difficult to manage. In addition, you as a shop operator need legal support if you need to check or (re) set up GTC or clarify questions about liability, copyright, data protection etc. At this point, this manual offers competent assistance with all legal questions that can occur when operating your webshop. From the content: Basics of commercial activity Domain law and domain names Copyright (texts, graphics, videos, music) Correct imprint and GTC Data protection law and privacy policy warranty, guarantee, warranty, recall instruction Correct quotation description and advertising statements Price information Checklist Search engines, reminder, complaint Who is liable for who for?
content.title_en: Right for webshop operators : the comprehensive manual

content.text: Digital German lessons: productive use of new media. The book presents methods and projects that allow new media to be reflected and used in a didactically productive way in German lessons. The pedagogical discussion of digital media is still shaped by the fact that German lessons see their goal in preserving the "old" media (the "good" book). Therefore, platforms and social networks that have become commonplace for young people are primarily regarded as a threat. This perspective has spilled the view on the potential of new media. Philippe Wampfler changes this by showing concrete examples of how contemporary German lessons can reflect and productively use the changed conditions for literature, writing and reading. An introduction with didactic insights on working with digital tools follows teaching units that can be used directly at different school levels and levels of teachers. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Digital German lessons: using new media productively

content.text: SAP - the technical entry. The SAP world is big and difficult for beginners to survey. Who wants to be a technical expert in this field needs a broad and systematically built introduction to the architecture of this market leading platform for business IT. This entry offers the future consultant, administrator or developer. It helps to understand, implement and adapt the different products, modules, application and configuration scenarios. The title is not suitable for material managers and users of SAP modules in operation. However, if you have technical basic knowledge, you can master the whole world of this complex and powerful software from the basics (SAP modules and architectural layers, clients, roles and permissions) via configuration and customization (HANA, database connection, workflows and processes) to self-developments and evaluations (objects, warehouse, reporting, APIs) to master the whole world of this complex and powerful software.
content.title_en: SAP - the technical entry

content.text: The most well-known and productive author has an updated and revised edition of his introduction to the platform-independent programming language Python. The differences between the predecessor are rather modest. Thus, in each section, it is now omitted to point out differences between the version 3.6 and Python 2. Misunderstanding formulations have been corrected, sometimes smaller additions have been added and the script image improved, but the content largely comes from the preliminary edition. In the last chapter alone, which deals with the interaction with the Raspberry PI (Python is available on each device as primary language), there are more significant changes. In addition to the consideration of the Raspberry Pi 3 Model B, Theis dispenses with 3 sample programs and instead offers a new (fan control). Furthermore, a well-suitable entry work, here primarily for initial creation and as a replacement for worn-out issues.
content.title_en: Entry into Python

content.text: Basics of Electrical Engineering : the proven textbook for students of electrical engineering and other technical courses from the 1st semester : with 225 illustrations, 4 tables, tasks and solutions. In this proven textbook, which is now available in the 17th edition, the areas of DC technology, electrical and magnetic field as well as AC technology are presented coherently and clearly. Started with the treatment of DC circuits, the methods of network calculations follow; this is followed by the description of the electric and magnetic field. In the second part of the book the different areas of AC technology are dealt with. In order to achieve an optimal comprehensibility of the substance, the reader is gradually led from simple facts to more complex problems. Furthermore, tasks with detailed solutions are assigned to each section, which are of particular importance for the comprehensibility of the facts.
content.title_en: Basics of Electrical Engineering : the proven textbook for students of electrical engineering and other technical courses from the 1st semester : with 225 illustrations, 4 tables, tasks and solutions

content.text: Funding programmes and projects of the Federal Government with a robotics relevance since 2010 : short study. The focus of this study was Germany's research funding with regard to robotics. An overview of current specialist and funding programmes of the German Federal Government was given, as shown by the funding ministries. For a detailed examination of the funding projects contained in the programmes, the funding catalogue (FÖKAT) of the BMBF was accessed. The authors point out the restrictive comments on the significance of this data basis. In the study, however, as far as possible, there was a distinction between industrial and service robotics. However, this distinction cannot be made separately in practice of funding - observable is above all an increasing use of service robotics in industrial contexts. The funding volumes of individual programmes are therefore not to be allocated to industrial and service robotics in part. Nevertheless, the programmes and projects presented give an impression of the main topics and scale of the funding of the Federal Robotics project.
content.title_en: Federal funding programmes and projects with a robotics relevance since 2010 : Short study

content.text: The universe and I are: the philosophy of astrophysics. An instructive and fascinating philosophical journey into the world of astrophysics and a declaration of love to the exploration of the universe. Astrophysicists know a lot: that the universe is 26 percent dark matter and the black hole in the center of the galaxy M87 weighs as much as 6.6 billion suns. But how do they actually come to this knowledge? Could the universe in truth not look quite different? The philosopher and astrophysicist Sibylle Anderl is telling us with awe about the work of astronomers, who from smallest circumstantials like the light spectrum or the motion of the stars conclude on what planets consist of and what mass black holes have. The book is a declaration of love to the exploration of the universe. And a fascinating philosophical journey to the limits of our knowledge. "Sibylle Anderl has studied philosophy and physics and is currently working as an editor for the scientific resort of the FAZ. The book – its first – turns to scientifically interested readers who are willing to question the common observations and theories... The only scene is reburied by the Chinese. The only one of the Bible is the Bible and I.
content.title_en: The Universe and I: the Philosophy of Astrophysics

content.text: The textbook Kinderschutz. A systematic overview of the interdisciplinary field of child protection from the perspective of the profession of social work for the study and practice distinguishes this textbook. It shows which task and function social work in child protection has and which legal and structural framework conditions are leading for it in the perception and guarantee of the promotion and protection of children and young people. Kay Biesel, Prof. Dr. phil., Case Manager, Specialist for Dialogue Coaching and Conflict Management, Social Education/Social Worker FHNW. Since 2011 Professor for Child and Youth Aid with the focus child protection at the Institute Kinder- und Jugendhilfe of the University of Social Work FHNW.
content.title_en: Educational book Child protection

content.text: Room wonder : great ideas for small apartments. Living in small space - Compact living - Living space as scarce resource - Solutions: Built-in - Room divider - Seats - Beds - Multifunctional furniture - Stairs - Storage space - Entrance surface - Tailored work area - Work place - Children's room - Kitchen - Bathroom. Interior design - Custom work
content.title_en: Room Wonders : great ideas for small apartments

content.text: Best of Interior : the residential trends 2018. The large-format, attractive picture-text-band presents 21 award-winning and excellent furnishing concepts of bloggers and professional interior designers, selected by a jury around the "SCHÖNER WOHNEN" editor-in-chief
content.title_en: Best of Interior : the residential trends 2018

content.text: Exercise book Mathematics for scientists for dummy®. verl. Beschr.: For all scientists it is indispensable but not necessarily popular: mathematics! But mathematics does not have to be boring or difficult to understand, it can even be fun if you understand the basics and celebrate successes in solving the tasks. In this book Thoralf Räsch repeats again the most important formulas, definitions and calculation rules, so that you can immediately jump on the many suitable exercise tasks with detailed solutions. So you can prepare yourself perfectly for the next exam
content.title_en: Exercise book Mathematics for scientists for dummy®

content.text: The more clearly defined the function is to represent your own, neutral or hostile forces, civilians and even animals. If these are not controlled by human players, then the user is to speak of "more clearly the question here is". The more clearly the following is true: the more clearly the system is in the position to represent living beings.
content.title_en: Case studies on computer-aided conflict anlays using the example of Virtual Battlespace 3

content.text: The myth of cyber war is a good thing: the myth of cyber war is a good thing: the myth of cyber war is a good thing for the people of the world, the myth of cyber war is a good thing for them. The myth of cyber war has been deeply embedded in our imagination. Politics and the military are taking advantage of this fear. High time to ask: Is there really a cyber war? The political scientist Thomas Rid is certain: the cyber war is not taking place. The cyber war documented so far cannot be described as war, because there is no purposeful violence against people, the brutal destruction that is inseparably linked to the thought of war. Nevertheless, we can not rest calmly, because Thomas Rid also makes it clear that the cyberspace is not a good idea of the dangers of the war, the sabotage and subversion.
content.title_en: Myth Cyberwar : about digital espionage, sabotage and other dangers

content.text: HTML5 and CSS3 : Semantics - Design - Responsive Layouts. This volume of the "Library of Media Design" offers a compact introduction to the web standards HTML5 and CSS3 as a basis for creating multimedia and responsive websites. From the content: Semantics - Design - Responsive Layouts - Readability
content.title_en: HTML5 and CSS3 : Semantics - Design - Responsive Layouts

content.text: Küpfmüller Theoretical Electrical Engineering : Electromagnetic fields, circuits and electronic components. What is theoretical electrical engineering? -- Theory of electrical networks -- The electrostatic field -- The electric current field -- The stationary magnetic field -- The quasi-stationary electromagnetic field -- The instationary electromagnetic field -- The electromagnetic field in electronic components -- Mathematical fields -- The Laplace operator
content.title_en: Küpfmüller Theoretical Electrical Engineering : Electromagnetic fields, circuits and electronic components

content.title_en: The city from modern times to the 19th century : urban designs in Europe and North America

content.text: The Kunst-Gewerbeschule Zürich: Re-restoration and reconstruction for the Allgemeine Berufsschule Zürich ABZ. 'Suhfabrik' and 'Modewitz' are only two of the supernames that were considered to be the revolutionary new building for the trade school and the Kunstgewerbemuseum of the city of Zurich, which the architects Adolf Steger and Karl Egender had built between 1930 and 1933. Today, the generous building is considered one of the few icons of the New Building in Zurich. The school wing, with its flat roof and grid facades, is the epitome of a modern 'laboratory for industry', in which large teachers of applied art such as Alfred Altherr, Johannes Itten, Hans Finsler, Willy Guhl and Josef Müller-Brockmann shaped generations of designers and photographers. With a refined re-restoration and some novel detail solutions, the architects Silvio Schmed and Arthur Rüegg adapted the former seat of the legendary Zurich art academy to the current needs of the Allgemeine Berufsschule Zürich ABZ in 2016/17. These modernist monuments are a part of the historical monuments, and a part of the contemporary of the modernist and a part of the architectural architecture.
content.title_en: Kunst-Gewerbeschule Zürich : Re-restoration and conversion for the Allgemeine Berufsschule Zürich ABZ

content.text: Eurotopians: Fragments of a different future. How do we want to live? How will we build? Where can we find ideas for the houses and cities of the future? Niklas Maak and Johanna Diehl address these hot-hot-hot questions in their joint project "Eurotopians". In times of upheaval, the band takes a look back at the work of European utopians to find visions for the present. - In the 1960s and 1970s, visionary architectures emerged in Europe, which fundamentally challenged the common ideas of living. Many of these buildings have fallen short, the architects have forgotten - even though they still live there. Maak visited them and designed an "archaeology of utopian" that shows that the ruins are the decisive ideas for the world of tomorrow. Johanna Diehl created impressive photographs of great intrusion there. In the ruins of utopian modernism, they discover images of revolutionary ideas of life that seem surprisingly up to date. (Verlagstext)
content.title_en: Eurotopians: Fragments of a Different Future

content.text: Neuronal networks: basics: with example programs in Java. Neuronal networks are replicas of the brain on the computer, which are used in decisions which a person should make, but where a person is too slow or his use is too expensive. The book here introduces into neural networks; the reader only needs knowledge in school mathematics. It is therefore well comparable with T. Rashid, in which however sample programs are implemented in Python and not as here in Java. As a methodological introduction to university level, reference is to "Computational intelligence". The author starts with the early days of the neural networks (hebish formula, persceptron, hopfield network and then comes across the foundations of a bidirectional associative memory to the current back-propagation network. Subsequently, he presents application examples (of particular interest here probably the support of the purchase decision for a PC) and gives hints for programming. The examples (code download from the Internet) show very well on his own PC, how neuronal networks respond to different demands on different types of demands.
content.title_en: Neuronal networks : Basics : with sample programs in Java

content.text: The author of the book is known for his numerous introductions to computer topics under the title "Entry into ...". His introduction to an earlier version ("... in Visual Basic 2013" has already been discussed. In the current version of the book, W. Doberenz introduces the language, but he requires more prior knowledge from the reader. The present book is based on numerous tasks and exercises (with solutions in the appendix). The reader is introduced in small steps into programming with Visual Basic under the Visual Studio 2017 development environment. The focus is on basics (variable and data types, operators, controls, branches, loops, ...) and the error treatment. Very well considered are also database applications with ADO.NET and Internet applications with ASP.NET as well as the creation of drawings with the library GDI+. At the end are 2 major example projects, the game Tetris and a vocabulary trainer. - Also suitable for self-study well.
content.title_en: Entry into Visual Basic 2017

content.text: Creative! : systematically generate ideas at the touch of a button. In the book of the Creative Director of an advertising and marketing agency, it is first about basic attitudes, curiosity and thinking patterns etc. Then the creative process is described - what is at the beginning, what framework conditions and rules of play are needed, how are the right questions found, how is evaluated, worked out and realized. An entire enormously helpful chapter is dedicated to the idea killers. Chapter 4 deals with creative methods: brainstorming and writing, mindmap, morphological matrix, synectics, and also with the less well-known such as cross-innovation, collective notebook, brainstation, brainrunning, world café and others. Creative techniques, such as combining, disassembly, overdrive, perspective change and even more are the focus in chapter 5. Ultimately, marketing and stagings play a practical role here, as well as the design of products and services. Everything is very clear and enlighteningly presented, which help to illustrate many pre-eminent graphics. For designers, product and marketing makers.
content.title_en: Creative! : systematically generate ideas at the touch of a button

content.text: Energy compensation : a reference work for basic concepts, concepts and technologies : with 323 illustrations and 107 tables. "The reference work covers in over 2,200 articles among others the topics renewable energies, power plants, energy efficiency, energy storage, gas and electricity grids, energy economy and energy or climate policy."--
content.title_en: Energy compensation : a reference work for basic concepts, concepts and technologies : with 323 figures and 107 tables

content.text: Specialists Hazardous substances : Knowledge, basics and tips for the preparation of a hazard assessment according to TRGS 400. Those who prepare a hazard assessment for activities with hazardous substances must be able to have specialist knowledge according to 6 Hazardous substances regulations. Sufficient knowledge of - the dangerous properties of the hazardous substances used, - the working procedures and the activities to be performed, - the relevant regulations to be able to assess the working conditions and the defined protective measures during an activity. This book shows which knowledge - independent of industry, activity and operation - is required to be able to carry out a hazard assessment expertly for activities with hazardous substances.
content.title_en: Specialists Hazardous substances : Knowledge, basics and tips for the preparation of a hazard assessment according to TRGS 400

content.text: Basics of applied geophysics - seismics, gravimetry. The textbook is designed as an introduction to seismics and gravimetry for Bachelor students of geophysics, physics and geosciences. With many formulas, calculation examples, diagrams, tables and graphics. (3)
content.title_en: Fundamentals of applied geophysics - seismics, gravimetry

content.text: The author is also concerned with the creation of program code and gives advice in a humorous way, based on many examples and anecdotes, on how to create an effective, modern program code. This topic is discussed, among other things, in a very factual form and for readers with considerable previous knowledge of V. Vernon or U. Probst. In this book the chapter title "Prevent the end of the world" or the word choice "scratch software" reveal the style of presentation. But the book should be taken seriously. 12 chapters with code examples in Java and C also make clear to the programmer, what matters with a good effective program code, and that cooperation and an exchange of experience in the team can be very important. Among other things, the focus is on testing, OOP paradigms, design patterns, operational reliability and the renewal of a completely outdated software.
content.title_en: Better code

content.text: Data visualization with R : 111 examples. Verl.Beschr.: This book introduces the basics of the design of presentation graphics with the Open Source Software R, which leaves practically no wish open in terms of visualization possibilities and is increasingly established as a standard in the field of statistics software. Using 111 complete script examples you will learn how to create bar and column diagrams, population pyramids, Lorenz curves, scatter diagrams, time series representations, radial polygone, gantt diagrams, profile diagrams, heat maps, bump charts, mosaic and balloon plots as well as a number of different thematic map types with the Base Graphics System of R. For each example, real data are used and the illustration and its programming are explained step by step. The book is thus a valuable reference work for a wealth of application cases of data visualization, to which traditional application areas in science and marketing are increasingly added new areas such as big data analysis or data journalism. In the present edition, examples of cartograms, chord diagrams and new chapters of data visualization were added to the database.
content.title_en: Data visualization with R : 111 examples

content.text: A Report on Different Vibration Analysis Based on Acoustic and Mechanical Measurements. The volume contains a report on various vibration analyses based on acoustic and mechanical measurements. The measurements were conducted by the Materials Physics working group of the Marine Department under the direction of Prof. Dr. rer. nat. habil. Jürgen Göken. The report covers the following topics: A) Studies of the strain-dependent damping of the titaniumligation Ti-10V-2Fe-3Al at room temperature B) Acoustic measurements of the sound distribution on different organ pipes and on a piano resonance floor with the help of various acoustic detection systems C) Acoustic measurements on board the ferry "MS Ostfriesland" D) Underlining the correlation between the moisture content and the damping properties of spruce wood
content.title_en: A Report on Different Vibration Analysis Based on Acoustic and Mechanical Measurements

content.text: Digital HR: smart and agile systems, processes and structures in personnel management. What does digitalization mean for personnel management and how can change be made meaningful? Leading HR leaders answer these questions using best practice examples from different industries. The authors present concrete solutions in the form of concepts and tools. The editorial team thus provides HR staff with the tools for successfully changing strategies, processes, structures and systems. Content: Potentials of new technologies: People Analytics, Social & Mobile Media, Virtual & Augmented Reality, Artificial Intelligence etc. Development of an adequate HR strategy for the digital age Design of digital and smart HR processes: HR planning, marketing, procurement, development, deployment, evaluation, management and management Employee relations and management in the digital age Design of agile HR structures: changing roles, new units and agile working methods (publisher text)
content.title_en: Digital HR : smart and agile systems, processes and structures in personnel management
